loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty estan en el primer ciclo  del programa de comité, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, además de eso están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada uno se encuentra.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teonida, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está con ingresos muy bajos. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la venta de comestible, que ella misma hace, y en lo que le está yendo muy bien. 
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, harinas, verduras, etc. lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos, y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group called “Kuña Aty” is in its first loan cycle with the program committee.  The members are learning to work together.  In addition, they have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each member can become familiar with her individual situation.  

One of the members is Sra. Teonida.  Her latest survey indicated that she was at a poverty index of Level 1, which indicates that she has very low income.  Through her effort and continuous work, Teonida puts into practice the vital behaviors exhibited by a successful woman, which is helping to improve her poverty situation. Her work involves selling food that she prepares herself.  She is doing very well in this business.  

Teonida is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies such as meat, flour, vegetables, and other items.  This will help her to solidify her business plan, improve her income, and continue satisfying her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. 

His family's challenge is a lack of water storage facilities. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy a water tank that will benefit five family members. This will enable the family to store sufficient water. He hopes that in the future his business will grow economically to sustain his family. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda, 52, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, a businessman. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings, when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. 

Yolanda operates a food stall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Yolanda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables, and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as intelligent. He operates a butchery where he sells meat to earn an income. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient food. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank that will benefit six members of his family. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will get a motorbike. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 47 years of age, is a carpenter in Nairobi town where he makes wooden furniture such as chairs, tables and beds. He is married and has five children. He has been in this business for 14 years. 

He plans to use the loan to expand his business by buying more wood to make furniture. He also plans to buy nails and sandpaper among other materials. This will enable him to meet his clients' demands as well as generate more income with which he plans to buy more carpentry materials as well as improve the living standards of his family. 

Having paid back his previous loans successfully, this will be his 3rd loan term with KADET Ltd. He hopes to be successful in his business and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture.

loans.name: Tarhatin

texts.en:
Tarhatin is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, coffee, etc. in her general store business.

Tarhatin has been in this business for 10 years. Tarhatin earns additional income from farming/selling vegetables.

Tarhatin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk and coffee.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to re-sell in her rice business.

Jasmin has been in this business for 15 years. Jasmin earns additional income from pig fattening.

Jasmin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman. She has nine children with ages ranging from 13 years to 27 years. She describes herself as success-oriented. She operates a cereals store where she sells cereals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be water shortages. 

She will use the KE 26,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Maria de vive en casa de un familiar junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos,  ella se dedica a la compra, reproducción y venta de plantas desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela que la visitan para comprarle, es un persona honesta, humilde, educada y muy buen moral, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Maria solicita un crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de bolsas, plantas, tierra, abonos etc. Para poder mejorar su nivel de ventas e incrementar sus ganancias y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the family house with her life partner and their four children.  She has been buying, reproducing, and selling plants for several years.  She has a lot of clientele that visit her in order to buy from her.  She is an honest, humble, polite, and very moral person.  Thanks to her effort, she has managed to pay many of the family expenses.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to invest in her business.  She will buy bags, plants, soil, and fertilizers, etc.  She will do this in order to improve the level of her sales and to give her family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy bags, plants, soil, and fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Gotitas De Amor” conformada por  07 personas responsables y activas. Este es el caso de Judith la cual comenzó con la venta de productos de belleza, lo que pudo ahorrar para emprender su propio negocio  de la venta de comidas, ésta actividad lo realiza en las afueras de un colegio, siendo sus mayores clientes alumnos y profesores de dicho  colegio. Se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo sigue apoyando en su hogar. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, fideos, azúcar y así poder preparar sus comidas. El  grupo “Gotitas De Amor”  están agradecidos con el crédito brindado. Judith tiene 40 años de edad casada con 03 hijos dependientes. Judith es la primera del lado derecho y viste chompa negra.
texts.en:
The Gotitas De Amor communal bank is comprised of seven responsible and active people.  This is the case of Judith, who started out by selling beauty products.  She saved what she could in order to undertake her own business of selling food.  She conducts this business activity outside of a school.  Most of her customers are students and teachers at that school.  She is happy that, thanks to her effort, she continues supporting her household.  Her next goal is to finish building her house.

She requested a loan in order to buy supplies like rice, noodles, and sugar.  This way she will be able to prepare her food.

The Gotitas De Amor Group is grateful for the help that was provided.

Judith, age 40, is married and has three dependent children.  Judith is the first one on the right-hand side, and she is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 40-year-old with three children residing in Obay Polanco in Zamboanga del Norte. She is married to a farmer while she sells snacks in their community to make a living. After she had joined GDMPC, she borrowed a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to cook. 

She wants to build her own store to make more profit and save a portion of it for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Wasi

texts.en:
Wasi is a single mother with two children who go to school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan, Wasi wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth for resale.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is 61 years old and married with 2 children.

Gwena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks, sugar, and other groceries. Gwena has been in this business for 21 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Gwena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, soft-drinks, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. 

Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 39 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. These supplies will be for her a means of increasing revenue, so she may be able to generate a healthier income. She hopes to grow her business and wants to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

Rehana says thanks to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons for tailoring.

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es: Geoconda, es de escasos recursos económicos habitante de un barrio popular de Managua, es madre de dos hijos que asisten a la escuela secundaria. Geoconda labora para una zona franca como supervisora, en la actualidad tiene como necesidad principal mejorar su vivienda cuyas paredes son de madera y se encuentran deterioradas por los años de uso. Doña Geoconda corre el riesgo de que roben sus pertenencias dada la inseguridad de su casa y la alta peligrosidad del barrio.Solicita el crédito para comprar madera, cuartones, reglas y clavos para cambiar las paredes dañadas y poder brindar seguridad y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Geoconda has limited financial resources. She lives in a popular neighborhood of Managua and has two children, who are in secondary school. Geoconda works as a supervisor in a free trade zone. 

Her main need right now is to make improvements to her home. The walls are made of wood and they are worn down from years of use. Geoconda is therefore running the risk of her belongings being stolen due to the insecurity of her house and the high crime rate in her neighborhood. She has applied for a loan to buy wood, wooden beams, rulers, and nails to change out the damaged walls. She will then be able to provide her family with security and well-being.

loans.use: to buy wood, wooden beams, rulers, and nails.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita. She previously obtained a PHP 10,000 loan that she used to purchase tools and different products for her hardware shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another PHP 12,000 loan to buy hardware items and supplies and to maintain her shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita dreams of expanding her business, and she hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week.   There she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for hardware items like keys, locks, handles, wire, and other tools and to maintain her shop

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 34 years old and married. He has two children, aged 10 and 3 years old respectively. He is a milk supplier in Nairobi town. He has been in this business for five years, and it has been profitable. 

He will use this loan to buy more milk to sell. This will enable him to have enough stock and thereby be able to supply to other retailers in other areas of the town. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This will be his 2nd loan term with KADET LTD, having repaid his first loan successfully. He hopes to have a good future with his family.

loans.use: To buy more milk to supply to customers.

loans.name: Quan

texts.en: Quan is requesting a new loan to to repair her food stall and her house. The repairs will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers and have a better place for living. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing her sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her food stall and her house

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is 30 years old and single.  She operates a boutique business that has been in existence for the past three years, and the business is doing great. She started the business with a contribution from her mother. 

She knew Milango through friends, and she now seeks a loan to buy T-shirts, shoes, and handbags for sale in her business. This business is the sole income earner for her, and she works every day to make sure it succeeds. The challenges in the business are high fuel and transportation costs. 

She will save the extra income that she expects to raise from the new business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shoes, and handbags to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and is married. He is blessed with four children aged 16, 14, 11 and 6 years old. He works in a carpentry business in Nairobi town, and has been in this business for ten years. 

He plans to use the loan to purchase carpentry materials like wood, nails, and paint. He also plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business and cater to the needs of the family. 

This is James's second loan term with KADET LTD, having paid his first loan successfully. He hopes to become a successful businessman and live a comfortable life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy wood for carpentry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to process for her dried fish business. Cristina has been in this business for 20 years. Cristina earns additional income from a general store and by raising pigs.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to process for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is requesting a new loan to repair her house: specifically, to replace the roof and improve the foundation of the house. This will enable her to better store and stock the goods that she sells from the general store that she runs from her house. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to replace the roof and foundation of her house

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung would like to take a further loan to repair her kitchen and pay her children's school fees. 

Phung's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in improving her family's living conditions, and with that, she can invest more in her business and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions that way, too.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen and pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Sepelian

texts.en:
Sepelian sells traditional clothes and attire and has been running this business for 10 years. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children.  She currently makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shilling.

She will be using this loan to buy more traditional attire, shawls, beads and ornaments to sell in her business. This is her 1st loan term with KADET LTD, and she will use the anticipated profits to add more clothes and ornaments.

Her dreams are to grow her business, make more income, and have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and ornaments to sell.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a motorcycle for going to and from market. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for going to and from market

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as honest and determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops and sells them to earn a living. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of water storage facilities. 

Peris will use the 32,700 KES loan to buy a 5,000-liter water tank that will benefit 10 family members. This will enable them to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will have a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy a 5,000-liter water tank.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has three children. Her husband earns a living by doing part-time work as a laborer and barber. Elizabeth cooks food and sells it in town. 

Elizabeth is requesting a loan from Gata Daku MPC Microcredit to buy more ingredients for her food vending business. She hopes to improve her business and will use her profits to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Jeany Ann

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jeany Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from businesses raising livestock and farming sugarcane. Jeany Ann is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries for her general store business.

Jeany Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Married with three children, Gerald is earning a living through his motor transportation service. He has requested a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new set of tires. Gerald's plan is to acquire more motorcycles to expand his business, as he hopes to gain more income to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 65 years old and a mixed farmer.  He is married to Martha, and together they are blessed with children who are dependent on themselves. Charles has been farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses for his upkeep and that of his wife. 

Charles is applying for his first loan term with KADET. He will use the loan for poultry feed for his chicks and other animal feed for his livestock. 

With the expected profit from his farm, he will invest in large-scale farming. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed for his chicks and other animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and for her personal household and business expenditures. She also sells charcoal for additional income.

Julie would like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julie dreams of being more successful in her business, and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages that she will sell in her store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna. She previously borrowed 30,000 PHP to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business. The profit she made with the loan were a big help to her, her household, and her business.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to again buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products. This will allow her to add to her current inventory. The more items she can display in the store the better, as it will result in higher profits. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to increased profits with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta, 48 years old, lives in the Kaloleni area near Mariakani, Kenya where she has been operating a fish business for the last six months. The business has been growing. She is now seeking ways to increase her stock and, having learned of  Milango through friends, is now seeking a loan to buy more fish such as dagaa and makumba.


Marieta hopes the business will grow and she will be able to open another branch. The extra resulting income will pay her children's school fees and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy fish (dagaa and makumba)

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra, who appears in the picture, is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She studied at the university. She works hard to provide her family. 

She faces a bad situation, and her income doesn`t cover her family`s expenses. Sometimes she goes to her neighbors to keep her food and soft drinks in their fridge, lacking the money to buy her own fridge. So she is requesting a loan of YER 100,000 from AMB that she will use to help pay for a fridge to keep her foods and soft drinks. 

She hopes to own retail shop to increase her profit. This will ensure a better future  and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a fridge to keep her food and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mary Chrish

texts.en:
This is Mary Chrish. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Chrish hopes that her children will finish their studies and dreams that her business will be more flourishing. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Dyna works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ice cream in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Dyna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Dyna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh, 58, is married and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband runs a business selling motorcycles. Trinh earns an income from running a stall that sells coffee and beverages to people in her community. 

Trinh started her business twenty years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a new motorcycle and a greater quantity of beverages to sell. With the loan, she can better satisfy her customers. Trinh hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income for her. The loan will assist Trinh in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle and more beverages to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the age of 47 and a mother of 4 children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She is taking this loan for her son. Her son owns a business that sells and purchases vehicles' tyres.  He is a young and energetic person; through this business he generates enough income for his family.
Her husband has grown old and weak as well. Her husband does not do anything and rests at home due to weakness. 
Her son wants to buy more vehicles’ tyres to grow his business, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more tyres. 
Therefore, Razia contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for taking a loan. 
Razia seems very happy after taking this loan, and she says thank you to Kiva and hopes that the lender will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: To buy tyres of vehicles for resale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 52 years of age, married and had a child. She is a hog-raiser who lives at Alcala. She raises hogs and sells them to butchers upon reaching their optimum growth. 

Luz would like to keep improving her hog-raising business, but because she had insufficient capital, Luz decided to ask for a loan of PHP (Philippine pesos) 5,000, which will be used to buy feed and medicines. She knows that this amount will enable her to maintain good growth of her hogs and have a better income someday.

Luz hopes to maintain her business and become a successful hog-raiser in their village.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously accessed a 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase different accessories and personal products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has an electronic loading station for additional income.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP, to buy different accessories and personal products needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to expand, and she dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different accessories and personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mitche Group

texts.fr: MITCHE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Marthe Cholakounmi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Félix. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marthe Cholakounmi n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille, Marthe Cholakounmi mène comme activité depuis huit ans, la vente de mèches à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Marthe Cholakounmi vend de la glace et du jus de bissap. Marthe Cholakounmi achète ses produits au Nigéria et aussi dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Marthe Cholakounmi et les autres membres du groupe MITCHE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mitche is a group of three people, the members of whom are friends and belong to the same savings group.  The representative of the group, Marthe Cholakounmi (with her hand raised in the photo) is 25 years old and married to a man named Félix. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school, and all of whom are in their care.

Marthe Cholakounmi did not attend school. To provide for her needs and help with the family expenses, she has run a business for the last 8 years, selling hair extensions from her home. As a second business, Marthe Cholakounmi also sells ice cream and hibiscus juice. She buys her products in Nigeria and also at a market in Benin.

This is the fourth time that Marthe Cholakounmi and the other members of Mitche are requesting a loan from ALIDé to increase their cash flow and improve their businesses, and better respond to the needs of their customers. Their previous loans were all fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, sugar, and hibiscus leaves

loans.name: Hildar

texts.en:
Hildar is 33 years old and married with two children, aged 11 and 3 years old. She owns a taxi and has been in this transport business for two years.

This is her first loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts for repairing and servicing her taxi. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business. 

Hildar hopes to expand her transport business, make more income and live a comfortable life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing her taxi.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 43 years old, a married woman, and a mother of five sons and a daughter. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this work for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, to satisfy the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Parveen says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 42 years old and married.

Eden works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Eden has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Eden aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1972 à MORON commune DE KADIANA, Drissa réside à MORON – village dans la (Sous-Préfecture de la 3ème Région administrative du Mali) avec ses 6 enfants et sa femme dans une famille nucléaire.
 Mr DRISSA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de petits ruminants et la volaille (moutons,  chèvre, pintade poule, coq etc.).  Il est très sollicité au marché et surtout le jour de foire. 
Fort de ses 6 années d’expériences dans le domaine, il collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
DRISSA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chèvres, moutons, poules et pintades. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants. Il effectue ses ventes en gros, en détail au comptant et quelques fois à crédit au marché et en famille à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in the Moron community of Kadiana, Drissa lives in Moron, a village in the subdivision of the 3rd administrative region of Mali, with his 6 children and his wife in a nuclear family. Drissa quickly became interested in small business, particularly the purchase and sale of small livestock and poultry (sheep, goats, guinea fowl, roosters, etc.)

Drissa is much sought-after in the marketplace, especially on market day. With 6 years of experience in the business, he is partnering with Soro Yirwaso to increase his business capital in order to meet the needs of his customers, which continue to grow. He is on his second loan, after having fully repaid the first loan.

Drissa plans on using his loan to purchase goats, sheep, chickens, and guinea fowl. He stocks up in the neighboring villages. He sells his stock wholesale and retail, for cash and sometimes for credit in the market and person-to-person, to a customer base made up of both men and women. He hopes to earn a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA, which he will use to provide for his family's needs, pay back the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and poultry

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es: Nidia es una mujer emprendedora, es habitante de un barrio muy pobre de la capital de Managua, es madre soltera de tres hijos quienes continúan estudiando gracias a los esfuerzos que Nidia realiza. Con la venta de productos variados como cosméticos, carne, pollo ha podido dar educación y salud a sus hijos. Con el crédito comprará nuevos productos para la venta como verduras e incrementar el inventario existente. Con esta diversificación incrementará la oferta a sus clientes y poder atraer nuevos clientes a su negocio.
texts.en: Nidia is an entrepreneurial woman. She lives in a very poor neighborhood of the capital of Managua. She is the single mother of three children who continue to go to school thanks to the efforts that Nidia makes. With the sale of a variety of products such as cosmetics, meat, and chicken, she has been able to give education and health to her children. With the loan, she will buy new products to sell, such as vegetables, and will increase her existing inventory. With this diversification, she will increase her offerings to her customers and will be able to attract new customers to her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, meat, chicken, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 41 years old and from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children aged 10 to 20 years old. For 10 years now, she has raised hogs for a living. 

Her business helps meet the needs of her family, combined with her husband's income through carpentry. She is asking for a loan to further expand her business. She will use it to  buy feed and a piglet.

Jovita knows the importance of education and she aims to make the most of her livelihood so that she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a divorced woman with no children. She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past five years.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 46 years old and married. She is the mother of a child. She is striving hard to meet the family's needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small industry. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing clothes for many years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the BRAC Pakistan, and she has gained a lot of appreciation in her community. 

Currently, she has requested a loan to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of buttons, needles, and elastic material. Then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

Khalida hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of giving a good quality education to her child through all her hard work in her business. Khalida says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more spools of thread in different colors, packs of lace, zippers, and buttons for tailoring.

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: Mireya, madre de tres hijos quienes están en edad escolar, los cuales acuden a colegios públicos cerca del barrio donde habitan. La actividad comercial de Mireya con lo que  mantiene a sus hijos es la venta de cosméticos, ropa variada y bolsos. Ella solicita este crédito para comprar más productos como ropa interior, sandalias, perfumes y pantalones en uno de los mercados de la capital para comercializarlos y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, de esta manera Mireya intenta salir adelante junto a su familia.
texts.en: Mireya is the mother of three children who attend local public school. Mireya supports her children by selling cosmetics, clothing, and purses. She has applied for this loan to buy underwear, sandals, perfumes, and pants at one of the city's markets to sell and offer variety to her customers and to keep moving forward with her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear, sandals, perfumes, and pants.

loans.name: Tobiko

texts.en:
Tobiko, 35, is married to Parakuo and supports a family of seven. The children are between three months and 12 years old. Tobiko is a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last nine years. His monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Tobiko is currently servicing his fifth loan from the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. This loan, for 80,000 KES, will facilitate land preparation and the purchase of seedlings to plant. 

Tobiko plans to use his anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming and build the family a permanent house. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to prepare the land and purchase seedlings to plant

loans.name: María Lisseth

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora, además de ser Licenciada en Matemáticas,  Profesión que utiliza como medio de vida, ya que imparte clases de educación secundarias en un instituto del sector donde vive, también ejerce la actividad comercial como es  la venta de fritanga los fines de semana en su casa, en busca de otros ingresos y poder tener un nivel de vida más cómodo, es soltera con 2 hijos a los que le está dando apoyo para su desarrollo académico, actualmente esta   presentando una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, los que están en mal estado, por esa razón visito a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y comprar  cemento, arena, zinc, hierro corrugado, hierro lisoy mano de obra. Y realizar la obra que tanto anela
texts.en: María is an enterprising woman.  Aside from having a degree in math, which she uses to provide her with a living as a teacher at the local secondary school, she also has a business selling grilled meat out of her home at the weekend.  She does this in order to make an extra income and to have a more comfortable lifestyle.  María is single and has two children, whom she is supporting with their school studies.  María needs to make improvements to her home which is not in a very good state.  So, she has come to Ceprodel in order to apply for a loan to buy building materials such as cement, sand, zinc,corrugated iron, iron bars, and to pay labourers.  With these materials she will be able to do the work that she badly wants done.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, sand, zinc,corrugated iron, iron bars, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa, es una mujer trabajadora que vende comida por las noches diariamente desde su casa de habitación. Los ingresos de las ventas le permiten cubrir los gastos familiares. Solicita el crédito para abastecerse de materia prima para la elaboración de las comidas que vende como carnes, pollo, queso, repollo, plátanos, etc. Con esta inversión espera abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y poder aumentar sus ventas aprovechando estos pocos meses que resta del año.
texts.en: Luisa is a hardworking woman who sells food every night from her house. The income from these sales covers her household expenses. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies like meats, chicken, cabbage, and bananas to make her dishes. With this investment, she hopes to meet customer demand and increase sales in the remaining months of this year.

loans.use: to buy meats, chicken, cabbage, and bananas.

loans.name: Ivania Mercedes

texts.es: Ivania Trabaja como Secretaria en un colegio de la localidad donde vive, convive con su marido tiene 2 pequeños hijos que  los cuida con mucho esmero como lo suele ser una buena madre, esta señora visito las oficinas de ceprodel y solicitar crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, piedrín, arena, acarreo, ladrillo y pago de mano de obra , y a si de esta manera darle mayor comodidad a su familia
texts.en: Ivania is a secretary at a local school. She lives with her husband and has two young children, whom she tenderly cares for as good mothers usually do.  She came to the Ceprodel office to apply for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, gravel, sand, and bricks and to pay for transport and labor so that her family can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, and bricks and to pay for transport and labor.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa had two children with her in Obay, Polanco in Zamboanga del Norte. She is widow. 

To make a living, she manages her own piggery, raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for four years. 

Nimfa has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy piglets and feed. 

She wants to build a pig shelter to be used for expansion. She also wants to improve her living and be able to save for her family's future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
This is Kristine. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy more merchandise products. Her loan also helped in the education of her children. Her income, on the other hand, assisted in their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise and products like electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags and other products needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Kristine dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise and products like electric fans, rice cookers, flat irons, bags and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José  es un hombre casado de 48 años de edad, vive junto sus 6 hijos los cuales son; 2 hombres y 4 mujeres en el Caserío El Panca, Barrio San Antonio, Sololá, Sololá.
Él se dedica al cultivo de cebolla en unas parcelas  que tiene a  pocos metros de su  vivienda. Esta actividad lo  realiza desde hace 25 años,  ya que desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron esta labor que es bastante productiva, porque lo que hasta el momento le ha  generado  ingresos y ganancias aceptables que le ayudan a contribuir con los gastos de su familia. 
El ahora ha observado que su cultivo es bastante rentable por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la compra de semillas de cebolla y abono orgánico que servirá para su cultivo.
Su mayor sueño es generar más ganancias para poder ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios para que tengan  mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
José is a married man who is 48 years old. He lives with his six children, two sons and four daughters, in the settlement of El Panca,  San Antonio district, in the city and department of Sololá.

He grows onions on several parcels of land that are a few meters from his home. He has done this work for 25 years, since his parents taught it to him when he was young. It is quite productive, since up to this time it has generated sufficient income and earnings for him to help him contribute to the expenses of his family.

He has now observed that his crops are sufficiently profitable, and for this reason he is applying for a loan of 4000 quetzales to buy onion seeds and organic compost that will help his crops.

His greatest dream is to generate more earnings to be able to help his children with their schooling, so that they can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and organic compost

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna es una señora de profesión maestra de educación primaria, preocupada por la enseñanza de los demás, casada con una persona a su cargo a quien le está dando el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo,  esta señora  presenta un problema en su vivienda la cual está en mal estado,  presentándose a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y realizar la obra que tanto necesita, ya que el mismo sería utilizado en la  compra de Zinc, Perlin, Cemento y Mano de Obra. Y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Digna is a primary school teacher and always worrying about people's education.  She is married and is giving her husband the necessary support to help him to develop.  Digna has a problem with her home, which is in a bad state.  So she has come to Ceprodel to apply for a loan and to do necessary work on the house.  She will use the loan to buy zinc, purlins, cements, and to pay labourers.  With this work she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc, purlins, cements, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Sob

texts.en:
Sob is 56 years old and a married woman with two adult children. She lives in a small house with her spouse and children in Reussey Keo district, a suburb area of Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving hammocks to help her husband generate income. She works hard from her home and spends at least six hours per day. Her hammocks are bought and sold in the markets by local traders. She has been in this business for six years.

In order to build a strong business, she has applied for a loan of 700 US dollars to purchase raw materials for producing hammocks. This way she will be able to sustain her business and make a stable income to support her family. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for producing hammocks.

loans.name: Kahindi

texts.en:
Kahindi lives in Malindi, Kenya. She is a 46-year-old married businesswoman. Her major economic activity is agriculture, and this is what she has been doing for the last four years. 

She does dairy farming as well as poultry. She also sells dry fish at the village market, and this earns her extra income. She hopes that her business will grow big enough in the next five years so that she can be able to win tenders of supplying fish to the hotels.The major challenges in her business are food prices and low season. 

She knew of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy chicken feed and dry fish for her business. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and dry fish.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is managing her buy-and-sell business, selling home gadgets, like televisions, karaoke and guitars. 

She collects payments in installments to earn a living. Her husband works as a private employee. 

Emma needs additional capital to offer more to her customers. She has joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative and borrowed 10,000 Philippine pesos to buy more home devices and gadgets to sell. 

She will use her profits for the education costs and needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional home devices and gadgets to sell

loans.name: Julia Marcela

texts.es: Marcela Labora en un centro de salud del sector donde vive, se desempeña como despachadora de medicamentos en la farmacia del mismo centro con 24 años de laborar,  es casada, solo tiene un hijo a su cargo, esta señora visito ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito  el cual lo utilizaría en la compra de Bloques, Hierro 3/8, Cemento, Arena y Mano de Obra, lo que le permitirá realizar la obra que tanto anhela,  de esa manera mejorar las condiciones.
texts.en: Marcela works in a local health centre, despatching medicines from the pharmacy.  She has been doing this for 24 years.  Marcela is married and has one child under her charge.  She came to Ceprodel to take out a loan to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and to pay labourers.  This loan will allow Marcela to do the work that she so desires and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blocks, iron, cement, sand, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Néstor Eugenio

texts.es: Néstor es un joven visionario además de ser productor agropecuario también labora como agente vendedor en la compañía claro de Nicaragua.  Es casado con 3 hijos los que están pequeños y les da el apoyo necesario para sus estudios, este señor solicito un financiamiento para invertirlos en la compra de cerdos, concentrados, sanidad animal y transporte, actividad de la que tiene 2 años de experiencia con resultados positivos, y la que le ayudara a mejorar  las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Néstor is a visionary young man who works in agriculture and is a sales agent for Claro in Nicaragua. He is married and has three young children, whose education he pays for. He has applied for a loan to to buy pigs, food concentrate, veterinary service, and transportation. He has had two successful years in this business, which has helped improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs, food concentrate, veterinary service, and transportation.

loans.name: Felipe Benito

texts.es: Felipe es un hombre emprendedor, casado con un hijo el que ya trabaja de manera independiente, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, también a la compra y venta de leche, actividades que tiene 37 años de ejercerlas, este señor actualmente tiene la urgencia de comprar cerdos para logar la fecha de inicio y esperar la cosecha de maní que tan solo  faltan 2 meses para iniciar oportunidad que logra para engordar cerdos sin ningún costo ya que el grano que queda impregnado en el suelo se lo comen los mismos, por eso visto ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el financiamiento y lograr el objetivo  planteado con esta modalidad de explotación con bajos costos. Lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y condiciones familiares.
texts.en: Felipe is enterprising and married and has a son. He has worked independently raising pigs and selling milk for 37 years. He wants to buy pigs immediately, as the peanut harvest is just two months away. He would have the opportunity to fatten the pigs at no cost because they will eat the peanut pods in the soil.  He came to Ceprodel for a loan to achieve his objective to expand at minimal costs and let him increase his income and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs and semolina.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 38 years of age, married and had three children. According to her, her generated profit comes from her hog raising business. Joy had been in this kind of business for about four years up to now. 

Since she aims for continuous smooth flow of her hog raising business, she decided to ask for a loan of PHP (Philippine pesos) 5,000 to buy feed and medicines for her hogs. She knows that through supplying her hogs with necessary hog feed and medicines, she could further improve their growth upon achieving their maturity period. In addition, she could also gain better income, which will be used for the education expenses of her children.

In the future, Joy hopes to become a successful hog grower within their local community.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her hogs.

loans.name: Nelmalita

texts.en:
This is Nelmalita. Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan was also used for the education of her children. She was able to generate bigger income, and that helped in her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are both working to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelmalita dreams of becoming more successful.  She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 55 years old, a single mother of five children, who are in school.

She has a business of selling vegetables in Naivasha that she has operated for 35 years.  She has applied for a first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy stocks of vegetables, such as tomatoes and onions among others, to sell. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to own a stall where she can sell cereals

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Marco Fidel

texts.es: Marco, a sus 49 años de edad, es casado y padre de seis hijos. Nació y creció en el campo, donde aprendió todas las labores agrícolas, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de fríjol y papa capira; adicionalmente alterna su labor en el campo con la comercialización de frutas y verduras en los municipios cercanos al pueblo donde reside, estos productos los compra al por mayor en el mercado del municipio de Sonsón y luego los distribuye en otros pueblos y municipios del oriente antioqueño, de esta manera complementa los ingresos que recibe para dar el sustento a su familia. El cliente es un señor pujante, trabajador, humilde y perseverante, siempre quiere dar lo mejor a su familia, por lo que lucha incansablemente para lograrlo. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras al por mayor (plátanos, papa, hortalizas, entre otros) para tener gran variedad de productos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo las diversas necesidades. Esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas y afectará positivamente la entrada de recursos económicos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar. Todo esto le permite a Marco seguir avanzando para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de comercializar los productos que cosecha, en la plaza de mercado en la ciudad de Medellín, además desea poder disfrutar al lado de su esposa los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
Marco, at the age of 49, is married and the father of six children. He was born and grew up in the countryside, where he learned all types of agricultural work. Thanks to that, he now has crops of beans and capira potatoes. In addition, he alternates his work in the fields with selling fruits and vegetables in the communities near the town where he lives. He buys these products wholesale in the market in the town of Sonsón, and then he distributes them in other towns and communities in eastern Antioquia. In this way he supplements the income he receives to support his family.

This borrower is a vigorous man, hard-working, humble, and persevering. He always wants to give the best to his family, and so he works untiringly to achieve it. He is applying for the loan with the goal of investing it in a stock of fruits and vegetables (bananas, potatoes, and other vegetables, among other items) wholesale in order to have a greater variety of products on hand to offer his customers, satisfying their varied needs. This will be reflected in an increase in his sales and will positively affect the inflow of economic resources to give his family better living conditions and well being. All this will allow Marco to continue advancing so that in the future he can complete his dream of selling the products that he harvests in the plaza of the market in the city of Medellín. In addition, he wants to be able to enjoy the fruits of his hard work at the side of his wife.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fruits and vegetables (bananas, potatoes, and other vegetables, among other items) wholesale

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
María Gregoria de 62 años, es madre de 8 hijos y se a dedicado toda su vida  a ser ama de casa. Lastimosamente, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar porque sus padres fueron muy estrictos con ella y no se lo permitieron. María es viuda, su esposo murió en el año 2011 y desde entonces se dedica a cuidar a sus dos nietos

No tiene ninguna experiencia laboral, toda su vida se dedicó a ser ama de casa y a cuidar a sus 8 hijos

El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de medicamentos naturales, ya que María se encuentra en tratamiento médico desde que su esposo murió, dicho tratamiento será de carácter natural y durara 4 meses.

María sueña con recobrar nuevamente su salud, para poder dedicarse a sus nietos y  quizá tener un pequeño negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
María Gregoria is 62 years old, mother of 8 children, and has been a housewife her whole life. Sadly she didn't have the opportunity to go to school because her parents were very strict with her and didn't allow it. María is a widow, her husband died in 2011 and since then she has been taking care of her two grandchildren.

She doesn't have any work experience, as all her life she worked as a housewife and taking care of their 8 children.

The loan will be used to buy natural medicines, as María find herself in medical treatment since her husband died, and the treatment is homeopathic and will last 4 months.

María dreams of recovering her health in order to be able to dedicate herself to her grandchildren and perhaps have a small business in her house.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, vive con sus padres,  y está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas y quiere poder utilizar todo lo que sabe en su propia empresa el día de mañana.
Quiere ser un profesional útil que pueda ayudar a las personas que necesitan. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Juan is from Caaguazú city; he lives with his parents and is studying Business Administration at the university and he wants to be able to use everything he knows and is learning in his own business one day. He wants to be a useful professional that can help people that need it. He seeks this loan in order to be able to pay his university tuition and in this way continue studying and be close to his goal.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es de la cuidad de Ybycui, quien quiere capacitarse y salir adelante. Su familia es quien la motiva y la ayuda a seguir adelante y luchar por lo que quiere.
Tiene como meta poder recibirse y también poder ayudar a las personas que lo necesitan. Está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, y quiere ser una gran profesional útil a los demás. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por sus sueños.
texts.en: Josefina is from Ybycui city, and she is someone who wants to educate herself and be successful. Her family motivates her and helps her get ahead and fight for what she wants. She has as a goal to be able to support herself and also help others who need it. She is studying Nursing, and she wants to be a great professional useful to others. She seeks this loan in order to be able to invest in paying her classes and university bills, and in this way be able to continue fighting for her dreams.

loans.use: to pay university bills and classes.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Elmie opened her retail store in Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children. Her husband is a private employee. She has taken a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy grocery items to sell in her retail store. She wants to improve her business to earn a better living. She is thankful to GDMPC for providing loans to small entrepreneurs and helping them to uplift their living situations.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, cooking oil, and bread for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a commercial coverstitch machine.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie is a 47 year old mother of an only child. Her husband is working as school maintenance man to earn a living, while she sells food in their community. She also offers  manicure and pedicure services to earn some extra income. She has taken a loan of  5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy a new manicure set. She wants to improve her services to gain more costumers and be able to generate more profits so she can support the family needs.

loans.use: to buy a new manicure set

loans.name: Maria Julyfa

texts.en: Maria Julyfa is 23 years old, and a single mom who makes a living with her buy-and-sell business. She offers beauty products to her costumers and collects their payments in cash on an installment basis. She has been doing this for two years. Recently, she joined GDMPC and took a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more beauty products like lotion, shampoo and make-up for sale. She hopes to build some savings for a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products like lotion, shampoo and make-up for sale

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina tiene 23 años, ella es madre de una hija, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agroindustrial. Comenta que su hija es su inspiración, que por ella lucha, para poder darle todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Quiere también ser una excelente profesional, para poder ayudar a las demás personas. Lucha por salir adelante y dar a su hija todo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder estudiando y estando cerca de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Karina, 23, has a daughter and is studying for a career in agroindustrial engineering. She says that her daughter is her motivation and the reason she fights in order to give her everything she couldn't have herself. Karina also wants to be a successful professional so she can help other people. She fights to move forward and give her daughter everything.

Karina is requesting this loan to pay class fees, which will allow her to keep going to school and move closer to completing her goal.

loans.use: to pay class fees.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She previously accessed an 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big [help] for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Gemma would like to apply for a new 13,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma hopes to be more knowledgeable in business and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.es:
Ramonita es una persona muy luchadora y que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que está estudiando, ya que quiere ser alguien en la vida.
Ramonita está estudiando Maestría en Psicología Clínica, con lo que quiere poder ampliar   sus conocimientos y seguir aprendiendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en los gastos de transportación y también para poder invertirlo en sus materiales, ya que es lo que más necesita para poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Ramonita is a hard-working person who wants to move forward. This is why she is studying, so she can be someone in life. Ramonita is studying for a Master's in Clinical Psychology, which will help her expand her knowledge and keep learning.

She is requesting this loan to invest in transportation costs and also to buy her supplies, since this is what she needs most to keep going to school. She is grateful for this opportunity because it will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay transportation costs and buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy buttons, textiles, thread and zippers

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, aged 36, is a resident living in the Ponhea Lueu district of Kandal province. He earns a living by farming rice and lotus fruits with full support from his wife and children. He also earns additional income by working as a day laborer and being on guard duty. Through his hardships, he is able to make a reasonable income to cover their expenses.

Now he needs a loan to purchase farm supplies for his crops such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. This way he can make sure that his crops are in optimal conditions. With the profit he expects to make from farming as a result of the loan, he will repay the loan to lenders and provide basic living needs and education to his four school-aged children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for his crops such as seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, quiere poder culminar mis estudios, poder recibirse y asi conseguir un trabajo digno y ser una buena profesional y  ayudar a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas y servir a la comunidad. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Griselda is from the city of Paraguari and wants to finish her studies. In this way she will find a dignified job and be a professional in order to support her family. 

She is studying for a nursing degree and wants to be able to help others and serve her community. Griselda is a person who wants to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to invest in the payment of her college fees and in this way continue working hard and getting closer to her goal

loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es madre soltera, sigue viviendo con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, está en el último año. Se ve dentro de poco como abogada en su propio estudio jurídico.
Su meta es salir adelante con la ayuda de su familia y su hijo, ella quiere poder darles todo lo que no tuvo y así mejorar sus vidas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y sus clases y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su objetivo.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother who continues living with her parents. She is studying Law and is in her final year. She will soon be a lawyer with her own firm. Her goal is to get ahead with the support of her family and son. She wants to be able to give them all that she did not have and in this way improve their lives. She is requesting this loan to pay for her college fees and enrollment. In this way she will be able to continue studying and little by little, get closer to her goal.

loans.use: to pay her college fees and enrollment.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is separated from her husband and lives in Obay, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte, along with her children. She makes a living by selling snacks in their community and at the same time raising pigs for sale. She earns money from the business and is able to support the needs of the family. She joined GDMPC recently and took a loan of 5,000 PHP to expand her pig shelter. She always hopes to gain more income and to be able to save for her family’s future needs.

loans.use: to renovate her pig shelter

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu is a married woman. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. She has operated a water selling business for the past years, selling to neighbors and fellow villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. She is requesting a loan of Kshs 25,000 because she wants to purchase a water pipe to use in water installation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pipe to use in water installation.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 65 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son in Dusheti district. Gulnara and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. The family has no other source of income. Gulnara has a commercial space where she opened a food market, but she does not have enough money for purchasing a stock of food and groceries to sell. 

She requested a loan, but as the family belongs to the subsistence poor category, and they have no source of income and live in poverty, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business. These institutions require stable income and business experience.  

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Gulnara to get a loan of $1,800. She will purchase a stock of merchandise such as food, groceries and household goods. Gulnara thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area.
