She is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Madina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also plans to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Ayidekon Ii Group

texts.fr: AYIDEKON II est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marguérite (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Akouté. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marguérite vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Marguérite assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de vingt ans, Marguérite vend du manioc dans une région du Bénin. Marguérite s’approvisionne au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Marguérite et les autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON II sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: Ayidekon II is a group of four people who live in the same district. The representative of the group, Marguérite (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a man named Akouté. The couple has four children, all at school and in their care. Marguérite lives with her children and husband. She and her husband cover the various household expenses between them. For almost 20 years Marguérite has been selling cassava in a region of Benin. She gets her provisions in Benin. This is the first time that Marguérite and the other members of the Ayidekon II group have requested financial support from Alidé so that they can boost their working capital and thus respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to buy cassava.

loans.name: Mistekhan

texts.ru: Мистехан 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Мистехан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Мистехан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 40 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мистехан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец, а также имеет 2,80 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мистехан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Мистехан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества младшего сына.
texts.en: Mistekhan is 64 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Mistekhan has a secondary education. As the primary source of income for her family, Mistekhan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 40 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 2,500 som (KGS). Thanks to Mistekhan's hard work, she currently has on her farm: 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 10 sheep, as well as a 2.80 hectare plot of land on which she grows beans and clover every year. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Mistekhan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum and Partners." She is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy a bull-calf to increase the size of her herd. Mistekhan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to hold a wedding reception for her youngest son.

loans.use: to buy a bull-calf.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman.  She sells  provisions in Asebu (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about four years.  As the sole breadwinner in the family,  Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business,  Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Salamatu from Kambia, in the northern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with one child. She also has two relatives at home. For the past 12 years, Salamatu has had her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to develop it further. She works 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning and drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her standard of living and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to open a big restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, cooking seasoning and drinks.

loans.name: Ayissogbe Group

texts.fr: AYISSOGBE est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Houélodé  (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est mariée à un certain Sokamè. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et quatre restent à leur charge. Houélodé vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Afin de contribuer aux diverses dépenses de la maison, Houélodé vend depuis près de trente ans, du maïs dans une région du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Houélodé produit de l’huile de palme (à base de noix de palme) qu’elle vend. Houélodé achète ses produits dans certaines régions du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Houélodé et les autres membres du groupe AYISSOGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: The Ayissogbe group is made up of 5 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Houélodé (who is raising her hand in the picture), is 52 years old and married to Sokamè. The couple have 5 children, some of whom attend school and 4 of whom they are still raising. Houélodé lives together with her children and husband. The couple both take care of the various household expenses. In order to be able to contribute to the different household expenditures, Houélodé has been selling maize in a region of Benin for almost 30 years. She also produces and sells palm oil (made from coconuts). She gets her products in certain regions of Benin. This is the first time that Houélodé and the other members of the Ayissogbe group are requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses, so that they can better respond to their customer demand.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bags of maize.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité San Expedito está en el quinto ciclo vienen trabajando muy bien en forma conjunta en la comunidad organizando actividades para fortalecer el comité. Ellas son de un lugar muy lejano, una zonza bastante rural, donde todas las integrantes están haciendo trabajos rurales para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Todas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos y demás. Una de ellas es Guillermina, y  solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para poder seguir alimentando a sus animales y seguir luchando por sus familias.
Ellas agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo para poder seguir luchando por sus familias.
texts.en:
The San Expedito committee is in its fifth cycle and they are working very well together in the community, organising activities to strengthen the committee. They are from a place a long way away in a fairly rural area, where all of the members do rural jobs so they can improve and make progress in life. They all work in rearing and selling farmyard animals such as chickens, pigs and others.

One of the members is Guillermina, and she is asking for this loan to buy balanced feed so she can carry on feeding her animals and working hard for her family. They are all grateful for this opportunity they are being given to carry on striving to support their families.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en: Gocha is a 31-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, Iamze, and 4-year-old son, Vika. Iamze and Vika are internally displaced persons and get a pension of 28 GEL each. Gocha is involved in the trading business. He purchases dishes in Kutaisi and sells them among the villagers. He requested a loan to purchase stock, such as plates, cups and souvenirs, but Gocha  lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for his business, as they require a stable income. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled him to get a loan of $900. With this loan he will purchase stock to expand his business, which will increase his income, and his wife will help him. With the increased income Gocha will provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Sohoueto 2 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 2 est un groupement de dix neuf personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sosthène Théophilia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Thoma. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sosthène Théophilia n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sosthène Théophilia vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans sa boutique. Sosthène Théophilia exerce cette activité depuis huit ans, et achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Sosthène Théophilia s’agrandit de plus en plus. Afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle, Sosthène Théophilia sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 2, l’appui financier de ALIDé pour une troisième fois. Sosthène Théophilia a bien remboursé les crédits reçus précédemment.
texts.en: The Sohoueto 2 group is made up of 19 people who all live in the same district. The group's representative, Sosthène Théophilia (whose hand is raised in the picture) is 37 years old and married to Thoma. The couple have 3 dependent children, all of whom attend school. Sosthène Théophilia did not go to school. In order to be able to manage her various expenses, Sosthène Théophilia sells beauty products and hair extensions in her shop. Sosthène Théophilia has been running this business for 8 years and she gets her products at a market in Benin. Sosthène Théophilia's customer base is getting larger and larger. In order to raise her business levels and better satisfy her customer demand, Sosthène Théophilia is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the 3rd time, together with the other members of the Souhoueto 2 group. Sosthène Théophilia has properly repaid the previous loans.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rayimsom Group

texts.fr:
Mr TEBDEBWAOGA CLAUDE est responsable du groupe RAYIMSON .Il est Célibataire sans enfant.Sur la photo, il est au milieu et tient son appareil de mesure pour le bois. Il n'a pas de charge.
Mr fait de la menuiserie depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les quincailleries en ville. Ses clients sont les entreprises.
Il veut s’acheter 04contre-plaqués, 05planches et des serrures.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son atelier. Il ambitionne travailler à ce que l’atelier devienne une entreprise et s’occuper de sa famille (ses parents).
texts.en:
Tebdebwaoga Claude is in charge of the Rayimson group. He is single and has no children. He is standing in the middle of the photo and holding his tape measure (for measuring wood). 

He has been a carpenter for the past 15 years and gets his supplies from hardware stores in town. His customers are companies. 

He would like to buy four pieces of plywood, five planks and some locks. 

Tebdebwaoga Claude uses his profits to expand his workshop. His ambition is for his workshop to become a company and he also wants to take care of his family (his parents).

loans.use: to buy four pieces of plywood, five planks and some locks.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling kenkey in Asebu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20  years. Mary is married and has three children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her kenykey business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business,  Mary plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize.

loans.name: San Miguel Kuñarenda Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que están luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus vidas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 6 integrantes están con indicadores muy escasos, pero deben seguir esforzándose por mejorar.
Una integrante es María, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, con ingresos medios, ella es consciente que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella se dedica a la venta de Bijouterie y, por medio de ese trabajo esta teniendo los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una persona que quiere salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida por medio de su trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouterie para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Caaguazú. All its members are heads of their families and work hard and fight to improve their lives. They took the poverty elimination survey and six ranked low, so they need to continue fighting to improve.

One of the members is María, who was ranked in a poverty level two, which means that she is in the middle-income group. She knows that by working hard and by thinking and acting as a successful woman, she will improve her current condition.

María works selling fashion jewelry and this is how she makes enough to help her family. She is a person that wants to get ahead and improve her life through her work. She is requesting a loan to buy fashion jewelry to sell. This will help her to realize her business plan and improve her income at the same time.

loans.use: to buy fashion jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Cecilia is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her banku in Esebu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling banku for three years. Cecilia is married and has two children. Her husband works as a pensioner. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Cecilia wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty banku. In the long term, Cecilia plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are in school. Since 2010, Asha has been managing her family by running a business selling lake fishes (fresh fish supplier). She works from 10am to 6pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Asha's 3rd loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy more fish, which is supplied to more customers. Her profit was used to cover household expenses and pay for her children's school fees. She has paid all of her previous loans successfully. Asha will use this loan to buy more lake fish to sell to more people. She has planned to own a food selling shop in the future. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kilombero" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more lake fishes to resell to more people.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa 1 está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas esta trabajando mucho por poder mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia. El grupo es  muy unido, en donde realizan actividades para incentivar el compañerismo y la solidaridad entre las integrantes. 
Una de ellas es la Sra. Francisca, quien se dedica a la venta de Asaditos (churrazcos), es un trabajo muy sacrificado y ella lo hace por poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder crecer e ir mejorando en su trabajo y cada día poder ayudar con mejores ingresos para su familia. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, palillos para broches, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando y luchando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Guapa 1 is in its third cycle of the women's committee programme, in which they are all working hard to improve their lives and those of their families. They are a close-knit group and carry out activities to encourage friendship and solidarity between the members.

One of the members is Francisca, who sells "Asaditos" [barbecued meat]. It is hard work and she does it to help her family. Her goal is to grow and keep improving her business and to be able to help her family every day with better income. 

Francisca is asking for this loan to buy meat, condiments, barbecue skewers and other items, so she can carry on working and striving for progress. She is grateful for this opportunity which she is being given.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, skewers for kebabs and other items.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina viene de una familia humilde su aspiración es terminar  su carrera y comenzar a trabajar como Licenciada en Enfermería  en la compañía de su ciudad y de esa manera ayudar a varias personas que necesitan y a la vez tener un ingreso mayor y más seguro para su hogar.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que tiene muchos gastos y quiere poder cubrirlos y así estar cada vez mas cerca de cumplir con su meta. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Cristina is from a very humble family and her goal is to finish her nursing degree and work for a company in her city.  She wants to help people in need, while also earning more income to give her household more stability.

She is requesting a loan to pay higher education costs, which have become more difficult to pay the closer she gets to her goal.  She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Adan

texts.es:
Adan terminó la secundaria en el año 2010, luego de unos meses empezó a estudiar en una Universidad en donde hoy en día estoy cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Análisis de Sistema, que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está terminando.
Sus metas son terminar la carrera, conseguir un trabajo estable en una gran empresa y así mejorar mi calidad de vida y también ayuda a su familia, crecer como profesional y como persona.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de universidad y también en pagar sus clases, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Adan finished high school in 2010 and then began his university studies.  He is currently in his third year of Systems Analysis.  He is finishing his degree with a lot of effort and dedication.

His goals are to graduate, get a stable job at a big company, improve his lifestyle and help his family.  He wants to grow both professionally and personally.

Adan is requesting a loan to pay higher education costs so he can continue studying.

loans.use: To pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Por Siempre” esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una, gracias al esfuerzo que vienen haciendo cada vez van mejorando mas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elsa quien tiene una despensa, en la que trabaja todos los días incansablemente. Ella por medio del esfuerzo que viene haciendo, está mejorando su negocio y va invirtiendo en él para mejorarlo. Hoy pide de este crédito justamente para poder invertirlo en su negocio, ya que quiere comprar insumos para poder venderlos, como ser comestibles, bebidas, verduras, panificados y demás. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
The "Por Siempre" group is currently undergoing the poverty elimination survey in order to understand each member's personal circumstances.  Thanks to their efforts, all the members are continuing to improve.

One member of the group is Elsa, who works tirelessly every day in her grocery store. Through her efforts, Elsa is improving her business and investing in it in order to progress.  Today she is applying for a loan for this very reason - to invest in her business.  She wants to buy supplies to sell such as consumable products, drinks, vegetables, bread products, and other items.  Elsa is grateful for this support - it will be very useful for her.

loans.use: to buy consumable products, drinks, vegetables, bread products, and other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Señor Juan tiene 43 años de edad, está casado y es comerciante de la ciudad de Encarnación, el se tiene un tambo de vacas,  además es agricultor, y comenta que ordeña más de 90 litros de leche por día que distribuye en su totalidad por la zona de la ciudad, se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 8 años, por lo que ya es un comerciante muy conocido.
Tiene mucha clientela ya que además le distribuye leche por otras zonas que no son de la ciudad. Gracias a esta actividad él ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar los gastos de la casa.
El solicita de este crédito para poder comprar una vaca, y de esa forma tener otra lechera para una mayor producción de leche y así seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 years old, married, and is a businessman from the city of Encarnación.  Juan has a small dairy farm and also works in agriculture. He tells us that he milks more than 90 litres of milk every day, which is then distributed across the city.  Juan has been doing this work for over nine years and so is a well-known businessman.

Juan has many customers as he also sells milk in other areas outside of the city.  Thanks to this work, Juan has been able to get ahead, to support his household, and cover many household costs.

Juan is applying for this loan in order to buy a cow.  That way he will have another source of milk in order to increase his milk production, and he will be able to continue working and helping his family.

loans.use: to buy a diary cow.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres que quieren salir adelante para poder ayudar a sus familias y así darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Teresa es una de ellas, y comenta que se dedica al reciclaje de productos como ser cartón, platicos, aluminio y demás.  Es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero ella está muy orgullosa ya que es un trabajo honesto y con ello mantiene a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que le podrá ayudar a seguir trabajando.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cartones, aluminio y demás, que ella podrá revender y de esa forma tener un mejor porcentaje de ganancias.
texts.en:
The "María Auxiliadora" group is on its second loan cycle with the women's committee programme.  All the women want to get ahead so as to be able to help their families and give them what they were not able to have.

Teresa is one member of the group and she tells us that she makes a living recycling products such as card, plastic, aluminium and other items.  This is very demanding work but Teresa is proud as it is honest work and, with it, she can support her family.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving, as it will help her to continue working.

Teresa is applying for this loan to invest in buying cartons, aluminium, and more, to resell.  She will then have a higher profit margin.

loans.use: to buy cartons, aluminium, and more, to resell and make higher profits.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: Osvaldo es miembro de una familia de 9 hijos, el está trabajando en el sector comercial como vendedor  y a la vez tiene aspiraciones de conseguir su título Universitario. Está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, para poder ser un buen profesional, que sea útil a la sociedad misma. Solicita de este crédito para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma seguir estudiando y seguir luchando por lograr su meta del título.
texts.en: Osvaldo is one of nine siblings.  He is working as a salesman and, at the same time, is studying to complete his university degree.  Osvaldo is studying commercial engineering so that he can become a professional who is useful for society.  Osvaldo is applying for this loan to pay university fees and thus to continue studying and fighting to achieve his goal of graduating.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una persona que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio esta creciendo y saliendo adelante. Ha luchado mucho por mejorar e ir creciendo en su negocio. Su crédito anterior lo ha usado para poder comprar madera para su negocio y de esa forma poder surtirse y seguir dando a su clientela todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar materiales diversos para su carpintería, y con ello poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Natividad, with a lot of effort and sacrifice, is growing and getting ahead.  He has fought very hard to improve and expand his business. He used his previous loan to buy wood for his business, and he was able to stock up and continue giving his customers everything that they need.

Natividad is applying for this loan to buy various materials for his carpentry work.  With these materials he will be able to offer his customers better service. Natividad is grateful for this new opportunity, which will allow him to keep working.

loans.use: to buy various materials to use in carpentry work.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education,  Ekua   is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling  charcoal in  Asebu (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for  six  years.  Ekua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

 Ekua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of bags of charcoal. In the long term,  Ekua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of charcoal

loans.name: Mutah

texts.en:
Mutah is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past one year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, cooking  oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is married with four children. She received some schooling til the end of junior high school. 

Currently, Faustina sells frozen meat and chicken in Asebu, near Cape Coast; she has been involved in this industry for about a year.  Her husband is a auto mechanic. Faustina’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  

Faustina will use the loan to increase her existing frozen meat and chicken inventory. 

With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Faustina  plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: increase her existing frozen meat and chicken inventory.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is 27 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife.  

Rami sells various kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items. He opened the store less than two years ago.

Rami is requesting a loan of USD 1,500 to purchase shelves, a cash machine, and a refrigerator, so he would be able to increase the store's stock. 

He is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. He hopes to be able to ensure a good future for his family. Rami is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase shelves, a cash machine, and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mariatu from Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with six children.  She began this business to make her daily bread. 

Mariatu runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, ground nuts, pepper and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business. 

Mariatu has requested a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to change her business to a provisions store. 

She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua  is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves. She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in  Asebu, near Cape Coast. She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for  20 years.  

Efua is married and has four children, and her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.  

Ekua wants to use her loan to purchase a larger quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.  As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. 

In the long term,  Efua  plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to purchase maize flour, rice, tomatoes, vegetables, cooking oil and potatoes for her business. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, tomatoes, vegetables, cooking oil and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadiatu from Kambia's northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children.  She started this business to improve her life and family welfare.

Kadiatu runs a food stand business within a busy market area.  She sells rice, palm oil, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for since 2008, and she works at the business eleven hours every day. She says the main challenge to her business is transportation problems. 

Kadiatu has requested a loan to buy rice, tomato paste, cooking oil, and cooking season. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomato paste, cooking oil, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Jeikhun

texts.en:
Jeikhun is a 26-year-old married man. He lives with his large family: wife, parents, and grandparents in the Gardabani district in eastern Georgia. His grandparents are provided with a retirement pension. 

The family has been running an agricultural business for five years. Specifically, they grow trees and from the trees they make brooms to sell. 

Jeikhun decided to diversify the business and raise calves to sell. He requested a loan several times but his attempts were rejected. The start up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and MFO Credo, gave him a chance to get a loan of 3,100 Gel. With this credit, Jeikhun will purchase four calves, raise them, and sell them in his district. The increased income will help him to the cover expenses of his family.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Kumah

texts.en:
Kumah is 33 years old and lives in a community surrounding Airport, Liberia. She did not attend school. Kumah is married and has five children between 1 and 12 years old. All of them are living at home but only four attend school. For the past 12 years she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She started this business with one crate of soft drinks. She likes her business because it’s profitable. 

Kumah is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks by the crate for the business. She plans to build an oven, send her children to school, and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks by the crate for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Hawa from Lunsar. She is married and has six children.  She started business to create a source of income.

Hawa runs a retails business, she sells palm oil, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present her major problem is slow purchasing power of customers.

Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 50-year-old Jeneba from Lunsar. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 years and 22 years. Four of her children are currently attending school.

Jeneba runs a retails business; she sells onions, cooking oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present, her major problem is the slow purchasing power of customers.

Jeneba has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like cooking seasonings, rice and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family. In the future, she plans to educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like cooking seasoning, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nishra

texts.en: Nishra is a 36 year-old married woman. She is running a beauty parlor in her town by offering many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials.  Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied a loan of Rs.20,000 through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia is a 36 year-old married woman and a mother of four.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past 10 years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.25000/- to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of elastic and zippers to meet the increasing demand.  In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of elastic and zippers.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor since four years ago. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best at providing services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for her parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her second loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. With the help of the loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Nargus

texts.en:
Nargus is 43 years old. She is a married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Nargus’ husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nargus has applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) for her husband. He wants to buy a new auto body for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nargus is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new auto body for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 25 years old and works from home as a tailor, which she has been doing for five years. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Yasmeen was not earning an income, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. 

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase a new stitching machine with spools of threads in various colors. This loan will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time which ultimately will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Fausena

texts.en:
Though Fausena grew up in poverty and without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Fusena is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her kenkey in Aseibu (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. 
Fausena uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their children. She has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her kenkey. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fausena wants to buck the trend of poverty by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, three of them are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a bar at the market and sells on a wholesale and retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of  2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerry cans of local gin, crates of beer, soda, and local brew. Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to only sell wholesale. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of local gin, crates of beer, soda and local brew.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards.  Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income whick she used in her saloon business.  She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.45,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, hampoos and hair conditioners

loans.name: Jaria

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Jaria from Port Loko Northern area. She is married with one child, aged 2 years. She is a housewife. She started this business to contribute in taking care of the home. 

Jaria runs general stock items at her house.  She sells cigarettes, milk, pure water, soap and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business after her wedding in 2005. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Jaria says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business. Jaria has requested a loan in order to buy more pure water, cooking seasonings and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and repay her loan. In the future, she plans to buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more pure water, cooking seasonings and drinks.

loans.name: Famata

texts.en: Famata is 39 years old and lives around the Airport community. She is single and has six children between 7 and 18 years old. For the past eight years, she has been selling red oil, rice, oranges, etc. She started this business with credit from her mother. She likes her business because the profit she can receive every time. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil, rice, oranges, etc., for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase red oil, rice, oranges, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 52-year-old vigorous married lady and a mother of three. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will help her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: Bilqees is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been running a business buying and selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices, near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good loan history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 36-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past 10 years. She has five cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. 

It is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. She has some past savings and applied for a loan of 25,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful to get an increase in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her ninth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 20-year-old married man who has been working in the agriculture business for five years. Hassan started working early, he was only fifteen years old, to help his parents make a living.

Today he owns a tractor, which he uses to plow his land and other things, in addition to irrigating most of the land in his village. He also distributes water to the houses of people who live in his village, because most of the time they lack water. 

Hassan applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to continue building his house, in addition to buying and  pasting tiles.
This will be Hassan's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in doing necessary maintenance to his tractor.

Today his loan will be invested in doing the necessary maintenance to his dream house, which he will keep on fixing, building, and expanding as much as he can.

In the future, Hassan hopes to keep on expanding both businesses as much as he can, in addition to developing his family's social and financial situations.

loans.use: To continue building his house, in addition to buying and pasting tiles

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 35 years old and married.  She runs a small general store in her community, which she has been doing for many years with the support of her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Sajida earns enough to provide for her family. 

Sajida is requesting a loan for 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates and make her store fully stocked. With this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Suria

texts.en: Suria is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of furniture making with the support of her husband. She has been doing it for many years. Over time she has become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of eight children and is responsible for providing them with the basic necessities of life. In order to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity, she applied for a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Suria dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood with packs of polish and nails in larger quantity.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Aminata from Port Loko . She is married and has one child, one month old.  She was a housewife but she wants to contribute to support the home instead of depending on her husband alone.   

Aminata runs general stock items at her house.  She sells sardines, milk, pure water and mayonnaise. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night.  Aminata says that at present she is faced with insufficient capital to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cartons of sardines, milk, and cartons of eggs. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and take care of her family welfare. In the future, she plans to open another shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cartons of sardines, milk and eggs.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with five children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mwanamkuu prepares snacks, such as cashew nuts, and sells to passersby and neighbours. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Salamatu from Port Loko Northern area. She is married and has one child, age 8 years. 

Salamatu runs a used clothing business. She sells women's and men's clothes. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business 12 hours per day, seven days per week. Salamatu says that the main challenge to her business is high transportation cost due to high petrol.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to buy more clothing for men and women. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living and increase her clothing stock. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 43 years old.  She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia.  She has been selling food since 2009, earning approximately $11 per day.  Her husband is a police officer who earns about $4 per day.  To expand her house’s space, Phalla is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase a plot of land next to her house.  This money will help her obtain enough space for her family to live.  In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her child earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en: Sareth is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her father in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Due to problems with her transportation, Sareth is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses and go to work on time. In the future, she would like to rent a store in the market to run a  tailoring shop and build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Ponny

texts.en:
Ponny is 62 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 each day. 

Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 daily. Due to lack of funds, Ponny is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase zinc and timber to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timber to fix her house.

loans.name: Srorn

texts.en:
Srorn, age 27, is a farmer and raises cows at home. He has been married since 2009, and he has two young sons. He lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. His wife is a garment worker.
Srorn is requesting his first loan to put an addition on his house.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, age 55, lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has eight children--two sons and six daughters. Four are married and live separately, one is a teacher, and the others are in school. 
Phan and her husband produce bean curd skin for sale. They also raise pigs at home. Phan is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and build a pigpen.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and build a pigpen.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian vive en la comunidad de Kucya en el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo, él tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces sus actividades económicas son la elaboración de pan, la ganadería,  la agricultura y brindar servicio de transportes, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Los tigres” y en esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Julian lives in the village of Kucya in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo. He is 42 years old, and he and his life partner have three children. He is hardworking and motivated and helps improve his family's situation through his labor. He makes a living baking bread, raising livestock, farming, and offering transport services. Because he is very responsible, he was invited to become part of the Los Tigres village bank. He is requesting a loan at this time to buy seeds and fertilizer. He is grateful and appreciates the loan, and he is committed to making off his monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is a 53-year-old woman. She lives with her son, Magarram, and daughter-in-law in a small village of Gardabani district. They are not employed now. The family’s only source of income is her husband’s and son’s salary. They work in Russia. 

Their village is far from the town, and there is no convenient public transportation to the town. In the village there is a low employment rate, and people who are employed have to go to town by taxi. They have already found a car to buy for Magarram to use as a taxi, and Elmira decided to request a loan for purchasing it. The Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of $2,000. After purchasing a car, Magarram will serve local people as a taxi driver and generate income. He already has a driver’s license.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Roin

texts.en: Roin is a 36-year-old man. He lives with his mother in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi. His mother is provided with a retirement pension of 125 Gel per month. Roin is unemployed now and his relatives help him to cover everyday costs. He decided to start his own taxi business and requested a loan to purchase a used car. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and MFO Credo, gives him a chance to get a loan of $1000 for purchasing a used car. He  already has a driver’s license and after purchasing a car, he will serve people as a taxi driver. His calm demeanor will help him while driving. Roin will be able to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a used car

loans.name: Apu Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Apu Los Nevados” en la comunidad de Carpapampa en el distrito de Paucartambo y provincia de Paucartambo. 

Exaltación tiene 49 años de edad y es casado, él y su familia viven en la comunidad de Carpapampa.  

Exaltacion es un hombre trabajador que desde muy niño aprendió de sus padres la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería, él es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante cultivando papa, trigo, cebada y avena, él en sus horas libres se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, gallinas y cuyes y también al engorde de ganado entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono.  
  
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la gansería, a la crianza de animales menores, a la venta y el engorde de ganado. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the “Apu Los Nevados” communal bank in the community of Carpapampa in the district of Paucartambo and province of Paucartambo. 

Exaltación is 49 years old and is married. He and his family live in the community of Carpapampa. Exaltación is a hard-working man who learned agriculture and how to raise small animals and livestock from his parents from the time he was very young. He is a charismatic and friendly person who gets ahead by cultivating potato, wheat, barley and oatmeal. In his free time he makes a living by raising sheep, chickens and guinea pigs and also by fattening cattle. At this time he requires the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.
  
This communal bank is formed by various people who are constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead and to give their children a better future by their daily efforts. The members make a living from agriculture, livestock, raising small animals, and selling and fattening cattle. 

The members are all grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to making their various payments in the established time periods.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yeretasso Group

texts.fr:
Mme VALENTINE est responsable du groupe YERETASSO. Célibataire, elle mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme transforme les céréales en grumeaux de bouillie depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché du secteur08. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 03sacs  de céréales (01sac de petit mil, 01sac de sorgho blanc, 01sac de sorgho rouge) pour la transformation en grumeaux.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’occuper des ses enfant et  à leur scolarisation. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Mrs. VALENTINE is the leader of the YERETASSO group. She is a single mother to two children aged 13 and 20 who both go to school. 

Valentine processes cereals into lumps to make porridge. She has been engaged in this activity for 6 years. She buys her stock at the market of Sector 8, and she sells to both men and women. 

She plans to buy three sacks of cereals (1 sack of millet, 1 sack of white sorghum, and 1 sack of red sorghum) to process into lumps for porridge. 

She will use her profits to provide for her children and to support their studies. In the future, she would like to run a large store.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of cereals (one sack of millet, one sack of white sorghum, and one sack of red sorghum) to process into lumps for porridge.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is a married father of two children. He is working at the Water Supply Company and his wife is a housewife taking care of children. Ismet has managed to build a new house but he could not finish it because of lack of money, since the money he generates through his work is not enough for him to provide for his family and complete the house. 

For the first time, Ismet is requesting a loan so that he will be able to build a facade on his house.  Then he will achieve his goal, which is to finish a house, to have a better space and offer better security for his family. The loan will help him to improve the living conditions for his family as he is hoping to offer a better life to them.

loans.use: To facade his house

loans.name: Bedri

texts.en:
Bedri is an Ashkali man living in an Ashkali (an Albanian-speaking ethnic minority) community in Kosovo. He is married and has three children between the ages of 6 and 14 years old. At this moment, neither Bedri nor his wife are working, and they receive a regular monthly payment from his brother, who is working and living in Germany to pay for their expenses. 

As most of the residents of Ashkali communities, his family lives under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. His house is very old with old doors and windows. His house needs some serious renovation so the family can live a healthy and normal life, especially with the upcoming cold and rainy weather. 

Bedri has requested a loan to replace the doors and windows and paint the house. He hopes this loan will improve the health of his family. He is very grateful to KosInvest lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: To replace the doors and windows and paint the house.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 52 years old. She is married and resides, with one child, in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling desserts for more than ten years, earning about $4 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Ly is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to prepare a better place for selling desserts at home and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Hing

texts.en: Hing is 45 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about $8 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Hing is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her save money on her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon is 54 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $6 every day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 per day. Due to lack of funds, Phon is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Cynthia did not have access to any form of formal education.  Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Cynthia is a seamstress. Cynthia has her own shop at Asafa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 17 years. As a divorced mother with two children, Cynthia uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Cynthia will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of the sewing materials that she uses in her sewing work.  That will aid her in improving her overall sales. Cynthia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials for her seamstress shop

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, three of whom are in school. She has one additional family member (sister). She operates a stall selling bread, blue band, milk and tea leaves on a retail basis at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works seven days a week.  She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy milk, loaves of bread, blue band, tea leaves. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholesaler and also to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more milk. loaves of bread, blue band margarine and tea leaves

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Ms.Rose is a single mother with three children, an old client of the institution, who applied for a loan of ugx.3,000,000. She runs a boutique of formal and bridal wear, on a busy street in the city center. She has been doing this for thirteen years. The purpose of the loan is to buy stock (bridal attire) so that she can raise income to keep supporting her family and support the one of her nephew with whom she stays.
Ms. Rose is an honest, very hard working single mother but is always constrained with limited capital. Her dream has always been opening up a number of branches for the same business so as to expand her income base.
Ms. Rose faces several challenges including high rent charged by landlords, competition from business people with huge working capital who tend to sell at a cheaper price, and limited capital to buy gowns for brides, which are on high demand. With this loan, she is hopeful that her customers will at least get what is asked of her.

loans.use: To buy bridal wear to sell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been successfully running a shopkeeping business for a period of about four years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. 

In order to avoid shortages, Shamim needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Shamim has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn is 40 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is employed in a clean water company. He earns about $10 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Lorn is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will enable her to save money on transportation and go to work on time. In the future, she would like to expand her business and decorate her house to make her living conditions much better.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sol

texts.en: Sol is 42 years old. He is married and resides with a 17-year-old child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a taxi service for more than five years, earning approximately $8 daily. His wife sells vegetables at the market. She makes an income of $2 each day. Due to lack of funds, Sol is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase construction materials to build one more room at the ground floor of his house. This money will help him provide enough space for his family. In the future, he would like to purchase a new car to run the taxi service and help his child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build one more room at the ground floor of his house

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en: Yieng is 60 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish and bananas for over ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. Two of her children employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Yieng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a generator to run an arc welding business. This purchase will help her to run an additional business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase a generator to run arc welding business.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Khuon is 52 years old. She is widowed and blessed with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating vegetables to sell and in tailoring for more than two years, earning approximately $5 daily. Both of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. In order to improve her family‘s livelihood, Khuon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This money will help her acquire the ability to start a new business and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to take another loan from KREDIT to fix her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Sarith is 50 years old. He is a widower and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been running a taxi service (motor taxi) for more than ten years, earning approximately $6 daily. Three of his children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $18 per day. 

To improve his family’s living conditions, Sarith is requesting a loan of $500 to pay for an electricity connection. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase furniture to decorate his house. This money will also help him access other electronic tools for his daily living. In the future, he would like to help his youngest child to earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for an electricity connection.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly is 33 years old. He is married and lives with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction since 2008, earning approximately $6 daily. His wife is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Sokly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to construct a building for his client. This money will help him generate more profit. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children earn a higher education. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his house to be more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to construct a building for his client.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Although he has received no prior formal education, Benjamin is an entrepreneur. He specializes in plantain farming and the selling of gari in Asafa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Benjamin is married and has five children. His wife is unemployed. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Benjamin wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of gari and also buy farm inputs to enhance his farming activities. In the long term, Benjamin plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase inventory and to buy farm inputs to enhance his farming activities

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income that she used in her coconut business. 

She would like to apply for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Zeeba

texts.en:
Zeeba is a 31-year-old, married woman. For the last three years, she has been successfully running a business of flower-making. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events, like birthdays, parties, etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies them in the local market.  

Zeeba has good communication skills and has a good client list. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy raw materials, such as glace papers, tissue papers, florist tape, and wire, along with packs of paints in various colors. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demands of her customers. 

Zeeba wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as glace papers, tissue papers, florist tape, and wire, along with packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Vida's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five women who sell slippers, wax-prints, scarves and plantains. 

Vida from Tehie-Accra, Ghana, is 52 years old and she is the representative of this group. She is a widow with three children; two adults and one dependent who is attending school.
 
Vida runs a retail business selling scarves and wax-prints. The business has been in operation for eight years. Vida requested a loan of GHS 500 to buy wax-prints and scarves to supply to customers around the town. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family's welfare. In the future, Vida plans to complete the housing project left behind by her late husband.

They need a total amount of GHS 1,700 to stock their businesses.

loans.use: To buy wax-prints and scarves to supply to customers around the town.

loans.name: Makfirete

texts.en:
Makfirete is 39 years old, married and has two children, 5 and 8 years old. Her husband works in construction and she is a housewife, staying home to care for the family needs and home. Makfirete and her husband have managed to build a new house but the second floor is still incomplete because they lacked the money to finish it. 

For this reason she is requesting a loan for the first time so that she can complete the second floor and allow them to have a better space and security for her family. The loan will help her to improve the living conditions for her family as she is hoping to offer a better life to her family and reach her goal to be able to contribute to her family's needs. She wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To complete the second floor.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
