Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara madera y tablas, las cuales le servirán de mucho para realizar sus trabajos, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser el mejor obrero de construcción de su ciudad.
texts.en: Pedro, 61, is single and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he puts all his efforts into moving forward. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and because he had to work, Pedro was not able to study a professional degree. On his own initiative, Pedro works as a construction worker on various projects in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours and he thinks it is going well because of his dedication and effort. Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided, he will buy wood and planks. These will really help him to do his work. He will keep working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of being the best construction worker in his city.

loans.use: to buy wood and boards

loans.name: Tiare Scanda

texts.es:
Tiare es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Tiare se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Tiare trabaja como asistente contable en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Tiare se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará utensilios y artefactos para acondicionar su cocina, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Tiare is a 20 year-old single woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and siblings. She is very hard-working, enthusiastic, and is really determined to do well in life. 

Thanks to her hard work and the support of her parents, Tiare is currently studying Business Administration at the university level. Through her own initiative, she is also working as an assistant accountant in a commercial business in the city. She works every day for approximately 10 hours, and believes that it's going well thanks to her dedication and performance. 

Tiare is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, and with this loan she will purchase kitchen appliances and utensils, which will allow her to continue working and to achieve her dream of finishing her university education.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen appliances and utensils.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 19 years old and a single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a very humble home. 

Ahmad's father is a worker, and he gets a low income. He would like to buy a laptop for his son Ahmad, but he could not save this amount. Ahmad is a student in the university, where he studies the Arabic language. 

Ahmad took a US$ loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies.  By applying this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his homework and write reports. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en:
Waleed is 22 years old and a single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a very humble home. Waleed's father is a worker, and he gets a low income. He would like to buy a laptop for his son Waleed, but he could not save this amount. Waleed is a student in the unversity, where he studies public relations. 

Waleed took a US$ loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies.  By applying this loan, Waleed will be able to do his homework and write reports. 

Waleed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and two of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 30 years. She works seven days a week.  

Fausta has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo, and rollers. Her major business challenges are "on and off' unreliable  electricity and ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a hand dryer so as to increase her sales. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more  hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo and rollers.

loans.name: Médessè Eugenie

texts.fr: Médessè Eugenie est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Médessè Eugenie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et est mariée à certain Enock. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Médessè Eugenie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différents besoins du ménage. Il y a environs seize ans que Médessè Eugenie  mène comme activité la vente de fournitures scolaires, des boissons et de l’huile végétale à son domicile. Cette activité lui procure des revenus non négligeables et lui permet de faire face à ses besoins. Médessè Eugenie s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Médessè Eugenie sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Médessè Eugenie is 42 years old and lives in Benin. She stopped her studies at the elementary school level, and is married to a man named Enock. The couple has three children to support, some of whom are going to school. Médessè Eugenie lives with her children and her husband, and together she and her husband provide for the needs of their household. 

Médessè Eugenie has been selling school supplies, beverages and vegetable oil from her home for about sixteen years. This business is an important source of income and allows her to meet her needs. Médessè Eugenie gets her stock in her region. She is seeking financial support from Alidé in the hope of improving customer satisfaction and increasing her sales and income. She has repaid all of her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies, vegetable oil and beverages.

loans.name: Konde's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois abritant ce groupe de vingt-quatre femmes est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Elles habitent le même village et font pratiquement le petit commerce comme comme activité principale.

Madame Kondé la représentante est âgée de 61 ans. C'est une femme veuve et mère de huit enfants (2 garçons et 6 filles). Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de "sankhal" mil transformé en farine. Elle capitalise dans ce domaine une bonne expérience de 10 ans. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite groupe et a levé la main droite.

Elle revend sa production dans les marchés de la ville et de sa localité.

Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 2 tonnes de mil pour la transformation en farine "sankhal"  et ainsi augmenter ses revenus. Elle est la seule à pratiquer cette activité dans le village.

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille et d'aider ses filles mariées dans leurs foyers.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois that supports this group of twenty-four women was created on December 14, 2008. The women live in the same village, and their main business is essentially retail trade. 

Kondé, their representative, is 61 years old. She is a widow, and mother of eight children (2 boys and 6 girls). She conducts a small retail trade of “sankhal” or millet made into flour. She benefits from ten years of experience in this domain. She is standing and raising her right hand on the right in the group photo. 

Kondé sells what she produces in markets in the city and in her local community. She plans on using her loan to buy 2 tons of millet to be made into “sankhal” flour, thus increasing her income. She is the only person in her village engaged in this activity. Her earnings allow her to support her family and help her married daughters in their households.

loans.use: to process grains for resale.

loans.name: Arleth

texts.es: Arleth de 40 años habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 5 a 23 años. . Allí se dedica a la venta de ropa deportiva e informal desde hace 10 años cuando se dedicaba a viajar a un país vecino, Venezuela, y observó que invertir en estos artículos podía ser de mucha ayuda, para el ingreso familiar, porque muchas personas lo hacían y conseguir recursos para sostener el hogar. Decidida, empezó a ahorrar e inició con una clientela doméstica, del barrio. Poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y hoy vende de contado y a crédito y está dedicada a su negocio de tiempo completo de lunes a domingos y de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche.  En la actualidad, meta más importante es aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y por ello debe aumentar sus ventas como es su propósito. Su gran desafío es alcanzar fuentes de financiación para capitalizar su negocio y vender mucho más.  Arleth está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, blusas y otras prendas de vestir, porque con esto mejorará los inventarios de su negocio y tendrá una mejor oferta a su clientela y esto es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Arleth, age 40, lives in a metropolitan municipality in the city.  She has five children from the ages of 5 to 23.  She has been selling informal clothing and sportswear for ten years.  When she used to travel to a neighboring country, Venezuela, she noticed that investing in these items could be very helpful for the family income.  This is because many people did it, and they got resources to support the household.

She decided to start saving, and she started with domestic clientele from the neighborhood.  Little by little her business was growing.  She now sells for cash and on credit.  She works full-time at her business from Mondays through Sundays from eight in the morning until eight at night.

Her most important goal now is to increase the quality of her life and that of her family.  In order to do so she needs to increase her sales, as is her intention. The biggest challenge is reaching sources of financing in order to capitalize her business and sell a lot more.

Arleth is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy jeans blouses and  other garments.  By doing so she will improve the inventory of her business, and she will have better offerings for her clientele.  This is exactly the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy jeans blouses and  other garments.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 22 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres, ella es muy trabajadora, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres,Maria pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Maira trabaja como enfermera en un centro medico de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Maria is a 22-year-old single woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her parents. She is very hard-working and enthusiastic, and has a grand desire to get ahead. Thanks to her efforts and the help of her parents, Maria has been able to study for a technical career in nursing.

On her own initiative, Maria works as a nurse in her city's medical center. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and feels that all goes well, due to her dedication and good performance.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva investors, since with their offer of help, she will be able to buy construction materials to carry out improvements on her home. And, thus, she will continue working and striving to reach her grand dream of being a great professional.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for making improvements on her home.

loans.name: Renzo Paul

texts.es:
Renzo es un hombre de 28 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia;lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Renzo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Renzo trabaja como controlador en una empresa de transporte de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Renzo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brinda comprara materiales de construcción para mejorar el techado y las paredes de su vivienda, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Renzo, 28, is single living with his parents in the city of Ica.  He’s very hardworking and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources and the need to work, Renzo was unable to study a professional career.

On his own initiative, Renzo works as a controller for a transportation firm in his city.  He works every day for about 10 hours and believes he does well because of the good way he carries out his duties and because of his dedication.

Renzo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will buy building supplies to improve his roof at home.  He will thus continue working and striving to reach his great dream of owning his own house.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a single mother of two school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Elías Miguel

texts.es: Elías es un joven de 22 años de edad que se dedica a comercializar productos de aseo desde su casa, actividad que inició desde hace 2 años, gracias a que su madre le enseñó la labor. La idea surgió cuando su familia atravesaba una situación económica precaria, pues no contaban con una entrada de dinero estable para solventar las necesidades y gastos básicos de su hogar. El cliente es un hombre activo, dinámico, con un espíritu emprendedor que lo ayuda a salir adelante. Se motiva a solicitar el apoyo de un segundo ciclo crediticio con el ánimo de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (escobas y traperos) para aprovechar el descuento que recibe por compras de contado, lo que le permite adquirir la mercancía a menor costo y por ende aumentar el margen de ganancia en las ventas, lo que significa generar mejores ingresos para su familia. Elías sueña con fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo crecer para que en un futuro pueda adquirir un local en el centro de la ciudad y montar allí su negocio para exhibir mejor sus productos y atraer más clientela, que le aumente sus ventas. Así tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elías is a young man of 22. He works selling cleaning products from his home, which he started doing 2 years ago, thanks to his mother who taught him the business. The idea came about when his family were going through a financially precarious time, since they did not have a stable income to pay for necessities and basic household expenses.

Elías is an active and dynamic man, with an enterprising spirit which helps him to get ahead. He decided to ask for the help of a second loan with the aim of investing it in buying stock in bulk (brooms and mops) to take advantage of the discount he gets for cash payments. This will allow him to acquire merchandise at a lower cost and so increase the profit margin on his sales, meaning that he will then earn a larger income for his family. 

Elías dreams of strengthening and expanding his business so that in the future he can acquire premises in the centre of the city and set up his business there. This would mean that he could better display his products and attract more customers, which would increase sales. In turn, this would mean that he could make his family more comfortable and offer them a better a quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock in bulk (brooms and mops).

loans.name: Victor Andres

texts.es:
Victor tiene 27 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de enfermería, la cual ejerce desde hace algunos años y por iniciativa propia desidio iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes,  cuando no está trabajando como enfermero, se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes y de esta manera puede solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que apoya a sus padres; Víctor cree que le va bien en su negocio y en su trabajo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Victor esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros; así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder luchar en hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de medicina y que su negocio sea muy grande”.
texts.en:
With much effort, Víctor, 27, succeeded in studying Nursing.  He’s been practicing it for several years and on his own initiative decided to open a small grocery store.  When he’s not working as a nurse he works in his grocery store thus being able to cover his household expenses since he supports his parents.  Víctor believes that he does well in business and in his job because of his strong drive to get ahead.

Víctor is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will buy merchandise like rice, sugar and noodles, among others for his grocery store to earn higher income and be able to make his greatest dream reality: to study Medicine and that his business be very big.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, está casado, vive con su esposa y su hija  que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y todo tipo de producto necesario para el buen mantenimiento de su plantación. El espera poder aprovechar su terreno y generar nuevas alternativas de trabajo. El espera salir adelante con el nuevo proyecto y generar una muy buena cosecha para así obtener el máximo de ganancias para el bienestar de su familia en el futuro. Son ya varios  préstamos que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is married.  He lives with his wife and daughter, and they are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, and all types of products needed for the maintenance of his crops.  He hopes to be able to take advantage of the land and to generate new working alternatives.  He hopes to be able to get ahead with the new project and to generate a very good harvest.  He will do this in order to get the maximum income for the well-being of his family in the future.  

He has received various loans from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no other loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided him with a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To care for his crops.

loans.name: Faustina's Group

texts.en:
The group is comprised of three members who work to improve the economic stability of their homes. They live in the city of Accra-Teshie, the capital city of Ghana. It is the birthplace of great fishermen in the country.

One of the members of the group is Faustina who is in her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She likes the group because all the members are good friends. The loans allow her to improve her family's economic stability.

Faustina, 38, is married and has two children, ages 14 and 6. They are schooling. Her husband is also a businessman who normally assists her with sales at home. Faustina has been selling 'silver' cooking utensils for six years.

She plans to use the loan amount of GHS 1000 to buy more 'silver' products to sell to customers. Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

Faustina is standing on the far left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy more 'silver' products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen dreams of a career in commercial engineering. Carmen is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Carmen plans on paying her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. 

Carmen currently works 40 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in engineering, she expects to earn $13 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Carmen is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Elena Vanessa

texts.en: Elena has always dreamt of becoming an engineer. Elena is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in petroleum engineering. She plans on graduating in July, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a loan, Elena plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Elena feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Elena currently works 30 hours a week. With two older siblings attending college already, Elena is unsure how she will be able to continue her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es una mujer con muchas ganas de progresar, sobre todo porque es madre soltera y saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a sus 4hijos. Para poder llevar un pan a su hogar ella trabaja alquilando un bote a los pescadores de su ciudad, el cual a equipado esfuerzo y ahorro con materiales necesarios para la pesca, asimismo tiene una bodega en la cual vende abarrotes y con ello tiene un ingreso extra para solventar los gastos de su hogar;  Dora  cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy cuidadosa y responsable.

Dora está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá realizar el mantenimiento y la reparación de los motores de su pequeña embarcación, con lo cual podrá seguir alquilando el bote a los pescadores y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio”.
texts.en:
Dora is a woman with a great desire to get ahead, above all because she is a single mother and she cares for her 4 children with great effort and sacrifice.  

In order to bring home the daily bread, she works renting a boat to fishermen in her city.  The boat is equipped, with great effort and savings, with the necessary materials for fishing.  She also has a small store where she sells groceries, and with that she gets extra income to cover household expenses.  

Dora believes that things are going well for her because she is very detail-oriented and responsible.  Dora is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, she will be able to maintain and repair the engines of her small boat, which will allow her to continue renting the boat to fisherman and to continue striving to make her great dream come true:  "to give her children a profession and to improve her business."

loans.use: Para la reparacion y mantenimiento de bote de pesca

loans.name: Shirley Del Carmen

texts.es: Shirley de 36 años de edad habita en un municipio cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 2 años. Desde allí comercializa productos varios en una pequeña miscelánea, especialmente perfumería y colonias. Su negocio inició hace 4 años, cuando imitando a su cuñada, que vende perfumes, decidió empezar su propio negocio, con el fin de ayudar  en   los gastos de su hogar, el cual se encontraban solamente a cargo de su cónyuge.  Shirley inició con un pequeño capital, ofreciendo perfumes masculinos y femeninos y hoy en día ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio. Sus compras las hace de contado y sus ventas a crédito, atendiendo su negocio, al mismo tiempo que sus actividades domésticas, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche de todos los días. Sus principales clientes son sus propios vecinos y amigos que remiten nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumes, pues su meta es el incremento de su clientela, porque quiere  una educación de calidad para sus hijos y su mayor desafío  es lograr  fuentes de financiamiento para aumentar su capital de trabajo, invertir y vender mucho mas; y justamente  es lo que logrará con su credikiva que proyecta ser exitoso.
texts.en:
Shirley is 36 years old and lives in a town near the city of Barranquilla with her husband and 2 children aged 12 and 2. From there she sells various products in a small corner shop, particularly perfume and colognes. Her business began 4 years ago, when, imitating her sister-in-law (who sells perfumes), she decided to start her own business, with the aim of contributing towards paying the household bills, which previously fell solely to her husband. 

Shirley started with a little capital, offering perfumes for men and women, and now she has managed to expand her business. She pays for merchandise in cash and her sales on credit. She looks after her business as well as her domestic activities from 8 in the morning till 8 in the evening every day. Her main customers are her own friends and neighbours who refer new customers.

Shirley is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy perfumes, since her goal is to increase her customer base. She wants an quality education for her children and her biggest challenge is managing her sources of income to increase her working capital and invest and sell a lot more. This is precisely what she will achieve with the Kiva loan which she believes will be a success.

loans.use: to buy perfumes.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.es: Marlyn habita al sur occidente de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 3 a 8 años; allí tiene su pequeña miscelánea desde hace 2 años, aprovechando que en casa de sus padres, que se encuentran en un país fronterizo, estaba ubicado un estadero muy reconocido por los habitantes de su barrio y de los alrededores.  Teniendo en cuenta el punto comercial, Marlyn decidió convertirlo en una miscelánea de mercancías varias,  y poco a poco fue agregando el servicio de fotocopiaje y alimentos, como frituras y refrescos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado así como sus compras y trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, de  lunes a domingos. Sus compras las realiza en el centro de la ciudad y sus mejores clientes se encuentran justamente en su barrio, donde hay aun un gran potencial que explorar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, variedades para el hogar, accesorios femeninos etc. Porque su meta es tener un inventario, provisto de todo lo que su clientela requiere,  para vender mucho más y continuar apoyando el desarrollo de sus hijos; mas adelante ella y su esposo planean comprar su propia casa y este es justamente su mayor desafío, por el cual trabajan persistentemente.
texts.en:
Marlyn lives with her spouse and three children whose ages range from 3 to 8 years in the south of the city where she’s had a small variety store for two years taking advantage that the house is very well located and well-known by local and nearby residents and belongs to her parents who are abroad.

Aware of its commercial potential, Marlyn decided to turn it into a variety store and gradually added other services like photocopying and food like fast-food snacks and soft-drinks.  She sells for cash and also pays cash for her purchases.  She works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night, Monday to Sunday.  She makes her purchases in the city and her best customers are precisely in her neighborhood where there is a great untapped potential.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy clothes, items for the home, women’s accessories, etc. because her goal is to have an inventory on-hand that contains everything her clientele requires to sell much more and to continue supporting her children’s development.  Later on, she and her husband plan to buy their own house and this is precisely her greatest challenge for which they work so persistently.

loans.use: to buy clothes, items for the home, women's accessories, etc.

loans.name: Victor Julio

texts.es: Víctor, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa y 6 hijos  que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los repuestos para la mejora de su vehículo de trabajo. El se dedica como un mecánico de la zona de donde reside y su medio de trasporte a brindar sus servicios como mecánico está teniendo unos desperfectos por lo cual el opto a solicitar una ayuda a la fundación. El espera con esta mejorar poder seguir dando su servicio a domicilio o cualquier parte donde sea que lo soliciten. El lo que quiere es aumentar su clientela y mantenerla satisfecha de sus trabajos y su atención brindada, a su vez tambien generar más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia a futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Víctor’s in a common law relationship living with his wife and six children who are his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy spare parts to repair his work vehicle.  

He works as a local mechanic and his means of transport to provide service as a mechanic is having some problems so he decided to apply to the Fundación for help.  He hopes with this improvement to be able to continue to provide home service or wherever else it’s required.  What he wants is to increase his clientele and to keep it satisfied with his work and service provided to earn higher income at the same time for his family’s well-being.

This is his second loan from Fudecosur. He’d had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda tiene 56 años de edad y habita en un municipio a orillas del mar, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Ella es la propietaria de una tienda desde hace 16 años, la cual nació, aprovechando que su barrio fue producto de una invasión de tierras, y no existía ningún negocio que respondiera a los requerimientos de la canasta familiar, y a las posibilidades de compra en pequeñas cantidades, que abastecieran los hogares de esta comunidad. Entre los principales artículos,  con los que empezó están los víveres, abarrotes, pero poco a poco,  le ha  agregado mercancías de misceláneas, como accesorios femeninos, artículos de papelería, y hasta gas. Todos estos artículos los vende de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, comprando de contado a los mayoristas que le ofrecen precios competitivos, para trasladarlos al bolsillo de su clientela.  Su meta mas adelante es mejorar su infraestructura locativa y remodelar su vivienda, aunque su mayor desafío es aumentar sus ventas, para obtener más utilidades y ahorrar para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará artículos de papelería y tanques de gas, así como también víveres que se encuentran en las promociones. Con su credikiva empieza el camino hacia el propósito que se plantea y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva..
texts.en:
Olinda is 56 years old and lives in a municipality by the sea, very close to the city of Barranquilla. She has been the owner of a store for 16 years now, taking advantage of the fact that her neighborhood was the product of squatting, and thus there were no businesses that sold basic home supplies in small quantities.

She started by selling food and basic living goods, but little by little she has been adding the merchandise of a general store, such as female accessories, stationery and even gas. She sells all these items for cash and credit, working every day since 6 am till 8 pm, buying in cash from wholesalers who offer her competitive prices so as to transfer these savings to the pockets of her customers.

Olinda's greatest goal is to improve the infrastructure of her store and to refurbish her home. Her challenge is now thus to increasing her sales, so as to obtain bigger profits and to be able to save money for this. This is the reason why she is now requesting a Kiva loan. With it, she will buy stationery and gas tanks, as well as the food supplies that are on sale. With her Kiva loan she will be on a path towards her goals, which is precisely where the success of Kiva lies.

loans.use: to buy stationery, gas tanks and food supplies

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis dreams of becoming a engineer but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Luis is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards his degree in engineering and is specifically interested in metallurgical engineering. He expects to graduate in August, 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Luis shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a loan, Luis plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Luis feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Luis currently works 30 hours a week and earns $8 a day. With a career as an engineer, he expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Luis's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of four, finances have always been tight. As the youngest, with an older sibling attending college already, Luis is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without assistance.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Benita Betzabe

texts.en:
To achieve her goal of becoming a physical therapist, Benita has enrolled in a kinesiology program at The UNICEN. She plans on graduating in February, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With this loan, Benita plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. 

One of Benita's biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. Currently Benita is an assistant in a physical therapy clinic and earns $17 a day. With a degree she expects to earn $49 a day. Benita's parents were never able to complete their primary education and so for her family finances have always been tight. With two older siblings, Benita is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Cristian

texts.en:
Cristian dreams of working in international trade. To achieve his goal, Cristian has enrolled in the business economics program at Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana. He expects to graduate in November, 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

For Cristian it is important to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Cristian plans on using the funds to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in La Paz. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With two older siblings, Cristian is unsure how he will be able to afford his tuition fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Cristian currently works 30 hours a week to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Ayesh

texts.en:
Ayesh is a 59-year-old married man from Gaza city. Ayesh lives with his wife in a small house in the city. 

Ayesh was a worker with a very low wage. He decided to start his own project. For the past seven years, Ayesh opened a small workshop for repairing refrigerators. It is a profitable job and he is a well known man in his area. Ayesh would like to improve his workshop.
 
Ayesh took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more repair pieces for refrigerators. This will increase his productivity and also his income. Ayesh appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy more repair pieces for refrigerators for his workshop

loans.name: Katherine Viviana

texts.en:
Katherine dreams of working in the international trade business. To achieve this goal, Katherine is attending the Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana. She plans on graduating in February, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Katherine plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Katherine currently works 30 hours a week in a shop and earns $8 a day. Unfortunately, Katherine's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Growing up, her household finances were always tight. Katherine hopes to be a role model for her younger brother by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 49 años de edad es la propietaria de un negocio, desde hace 2 años: allí vende accesorios, ropa femenina y masculina entre otras mercancías, mediante crédito que ofrece a su clientela  del barrio y de comunidades aledañas, quien también compra de  contado.  Esta pequeña miscelánea de artículos, está ubicada en el municipio de Malambo donde habita con su familia y donde es muy reconocida por su servicio especial a la clientela. La meta de Martha,  es aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por eso está empeñada en vender mucho más, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr rápidamente su propósito, y su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  jeans, ropa casual, accesorios femeninos y artículos varios. Con su credikiva ha logrado tener una fuente de financiamiento y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Martha is 49 years old and has run her business for 2 years. She sells accessories, men's and women's clothes, among other merchandise, on credit that she offers to her customers in her area as well as neighbouring areas, who also pay in cash. This little corner shop of articles is situated in the town of Malambo, where she lives with her family and is very well known for her excellent customer service. 

Martha's goal is to increase her sales and improve her living conditions, and so she is determined to sell a lot more, but her working capital is not enough to manage this quickly, and her biggest challenge is getting funding. This is why she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy jeans, casual clothing, women's accessories and other various merchandise. With her Kiva loan she has managed to get a source of funding, and this is precisely where Kiva is successful.

loans.use: to buy jeans, casual clothes, women's accessories and other merchandise.

loans.name: Samia Carolina

texts.es: Samia, a sus 28 años de edad vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental y se dedica a criar y comercializar pollos; hizo adecuaciones en un espacio de su casa para poner el galpón, donde cría y engorda a los pollos de manera escalonada para luego venderlos a un mejor precio. De esta manera genera los ingresos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer humilde, pujante y trabajadora, lo que le ha permitido ir progresando poco a poco. Solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más animales (pollos de engorde), para poder aumentar su producción y generar mejores ingresos. Así es como Samia sueña ir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de tener un negocio grande y bien acreditado, en el que pueda distribuir a gran escala y, de esta forma poder tener una estabilidad económica que le dé un futuro próspero y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Samia, 28, and her spouse are in a common law relationship.  She works raising and selling chickens.  She made adjustments to a space at home for the coop where she raises and fattens up the chicks in a staggered way to then sell at a better price.  In this way, she generates income for her home.

She’s a very humble, driven, hardworking woman which has led to her making gradual progress.  She’s asking for the loan in order to buy more chicks to fatten up to increase production and generate higher income.

Samia hopes to continue advancing to reach her dream of having a large, well-established business that producing in large scale so that she can have economic stability that will give her a prosperous future and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: Carlos, está casado, tiene la edad de 25 años y vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar lo necesario para iniciar su proyecto con una soda. El hace poco construyo un local cerca de un colegio con el fin de brindar el servicio de comida a estudiantes que asisten a este lugar, el espera poder generar una buena clientela y a su vez así generar ingresos para salir con el crédito y generar ingreso o ahorro para su futuro. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 25, is married.  He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority.  He will use the loan to buy what is needed to start his project, a small eatery.  A little while ago he built a place near a school.  He did this in order to provide food service to the students who go to this place.  He hopes to be able to generate good clientele and in that way generate income in order to get ahead with the loan and generate income or savings for his future.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has not had any other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with the better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his eatery.

loans.name: Jair Alberto

texts.es: Jair de 31 años de edad habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 8 años. Allí tiene una panadería desde Enero del año 2009, la cual decidió emprender, cuando dejó de trabajar para otros, en este oficio. Con su primer capital, empezó a elaborar panes, pudines y pequeñas bandejas de productos,  para eventos sociales, como fiestas del día de las madres, cumpleaños, primeras comuniones etc. Hoy en su panadería vende panes, rosquillas, croazan, deditos de queso, entre otros y los vende directamente a su clientela, que está ubicada en la comunidad donde habita. Su horario de trabajo inicia a las 7 de la mañana y termina diariamente (de lunes a domingos), a las 7 de la noche. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar la imagen del local y a nivel de su hogar, aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor desafío, es lograr fuentes de financiamiento y esto es lo que ha conseguido con su credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo en mayor volumen, queso, grasas e insumos varios, que aumentarán su capital de trabajo,  sus posibilidades de producir mas y vender mas y esto es justamente el éxito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jair, 31 years old, lives in a municipality in the metropolitan area of the city.  He lives with his wife and his two children, ages 2 and 8 years.  He has had a bakery there since January of the year 2009.  He decided to start the bakery when he stopped working for other people.

With his seed money, he started to make breads, puddings, and small trays of products for social events like Mother's Day parties, birthdays, first communions, etc.  Today in his bakery, he sells breads, doughnuts, croissants, cheese fingers and other items, which he sells directly to his customers who are located in the community where he lives.

His work schedule starts at 7 in the morning and ends daily (from Monday to Sunday) at 7 at night.  His future goal is to improve the image of the store, and on the home front, to improve his family's quality of life.

His greatest challenge is to find sources of financing, and this is what he has found with his Kiva loan, the first loan he is taking from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy wheat flour in bulk, cheese, oils and various ingredients, which will increase his working capital, his potential to produce more and to sell more.  This is precisely Kiva's success.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour in bulk, cheese, oils and various ingredients.

loans.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco y para poder salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de educación y poder llevar un plato de comida a su hogar trabaja como profesora en una institución educativa de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día; Jenny cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque tiene mucha paciencia con los alumnos.

Jenny está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder estudiar una maestría”.
texts.en:
Jenny is 41 years old and lives in the city of Pisco. To be able to get ahead she strived to finish her teaching major, and to be able to bring food to her home she works as a teacher in an educational institution of her city. She works for approximately 8 hours a day. Jenny thinks she does well in her job because she is very patient with her students.

Jenny is grateful to Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy construction materials to improve her home. In this way she will be able to improve her quality of life and will keep making an effort to achieve her greatest dream: to be able to study a master's degree.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pequeño hijo y sus padres, ella es madre soltera, trabajadora,que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Maribel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería.
Por iniciativa propia, Maribel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, tanto para damas y caballeros, ella trabaja todos todos los días en un mercado de su ciudad y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Maribel se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará una habitación en su vivienda, desea refaccionar el techado y piso de este, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 20 year old woman and lives in the city of Chincha with her small son and her parents. She is a single, hard-working mother, who is making every effort to get her family ahead. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work, Maribel was not able to study to become a nurse. On her own initiative, Maribel works at her own business, selling clothes for both men and women. She works every day in a market in the city and can be there for about 10 hours a day.

Maribel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help offered, she will be able to improve a room in her home. She wants to repair the roof and floor of the room, as well as continue working and striving to achieve her dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Erick Ronald

texts.es:
Erick es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Erick no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia, Erick trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Erick se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara un ropero para su hogar, ya que el y su familia guardan sus prendas de vestir en cajas y desean protegerlos de la humedad, así pues Erick seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una profesión.
texts.en:
Erick is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents and brothers in Ica, within the Parcona district.  He is a hardworking, enthusiastic person with a great desire to succeed.  Unfortunately, Erick was not able to study for a professional management career, due to a lack of resources.

Erick works as a field worker at a farm in town.  He works for about 10 hours a day and feels that things are going well for him because of his efforts and dedication. 

Erick is very grateful to the Kiva lenders and he was able to buy a clothing cabinet for his home, because his family was storing their clothing in boxes and they wanted to protect them from the humidity.  Erick will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of studying for a profession.

loans.use: to buy a clothing cabinet.

loans.name: Rubenia Dolores

texts.es:
Rubenia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar cocos, sodas, golosinas y dulces.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ingresos y aumentaron los ingresos; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rubenia finds herself in a position where she needs a new loan because she requires more capital. This investment will allow her to buy coconuts, sodas, snacks and candy.

The previous loan helped her to improve her income, economic conditions and family situation.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, sodas, snacks and candy.

loans.name: Teta

texts.en:
Teta is 24 years old, married, and lives in Airport in Margibi county which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia. Her two children, who attend school, live at home and her husband is a contractor. 

For the past 4 years she has been involved in business and currently she sells milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. She says she always uses a taxi to transport her goods to her business. She likes how her customers can buy from her, and she is proud of how supportive she is to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for 10 hours per day from Monday to Saturday. She is requesting a loan to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business. 

Her plan is to build her house. She is glad to become a borrower through BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, bread, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa de 50 años, tiene una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 20 años, quien no ha tenido la oportunidad de estudiar; porque le ayuda a su padre a trabajar la tierra y así contribuir con los ingresos familiares.

Tiene aproximadamente 4 años de ser porpietaria de una tienda, es un pequeño negocio que bien administrado puede dar grandes frutos, además se dedica a ser ama de casa.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar productos para la tienda, como azúcar, bebidas gaseosas, granos básicos y demás, pero sobre todo poner venta de recargas electrónicas para celulares, es lo que más le demandan y no tiene disponible.

María, se ha propuesto como meta personal, además de una tienda mucho más grande, comprar un molino de nixtamal para dar servicio de molienda.
texts.en:
María Luisa, age 50, has a store in which she sells basic needs items.  She lives with her husband and her 20 year old son.  Her son has not had the opportunity to go to school because he helps his father work the land and contribute to the family income.

She has had a store for approximately four years.  It is a small business that is well-run and able to produce great income.  She is also a housewife.

The loan will be used to buy products for the store.  She will buy products like sugar, drinks, soft drinks, basic grains, and others.  However, above all else, she will sell electronic recharge cards for cell phones.  This is what is in the most demand, and she does not have them available.  

María has set as a personal goal, in addition to having a much larger store, buying a corn mill in order to provide grinding services.

loans.use: to buy products like sugar, drinks, soft drinks, basic grains, and recharge cards for cell phones.

loans.name: Zakeyah

texts.en:
Zakeyah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her brother appears in the photo. Zakeyah is a 53-year-old divorced woman from Rafah city. She lives with her brother's family in a small humble home. 

For the past six years, Zakeyah has been working at selling kids' clothes in the local market. It is a good job but with very low and seasonal earnings. 

Zakeyah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more clothes for her store to resell. This will increase her income and also improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her store to resell

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Jesus no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Mecánica.
Por iniciativa propia, Jesus trabaja como obrero da campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Jesus se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorara su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado, paredes y otros, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jesus is a young man of 21. He lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very hard-working and enthusiastic man who is making every effort to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jesus was not able to study for a professional career in Mechanical Engineering. On his own initiative, Jesus works as a field hand on an agricultural farm, and he works every day for approximately 10 hours. He believes he is doing well thanks to his dedication and effort.

Jesus is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support, he will be able to improve his home. He wants to strengthen the roof, walls etc. and he can continue working and striving to achieve his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Hugo Alexander

texts.es:
Hugo de 20 años de edad, es un joven trabajador que solo pudo realizar sus estudios de educación media,  vive con sus padres, pero tiene planeado independizarse porque pronto contraerá matrimonio.

Desde que tenía 12 años trabajo en un taller de estructuras metálicas con un tío, para llegar a dicho lugar se desplazaba 4 km. Desde su casa en bicicleta y trabajaba de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm y por las tardes trabajaba también con su padre en el mismo oficio.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: bloques, arena, cemento, grava, también la compra de las instalaciones eléctricas y para el traslado de los materiales desde el lugar de compra hasta donde construirá su casa

Hugo tiene como meta construir su casa, formar una familia y trabajar duro para ver crecer a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hugo, 20, is a young worker who only completed middle school. He lives with his parents but he has plans to become independent because he's getting married soon.

Since he was 12 years old he has worked in a metal shop with his uncle. The distance to this place is 4km from his house by bike. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and in the afternoons he also worked with his father in the same trade.

This loan would be used to purchase construction material such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel as well as the purchase of electrical installation and the transportation of the materials from the place of purchase to the construction site.

Hugo's goals are to build his house, have a family and work hard to see his children grow up.

loans.use: to purchase construction material such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel and electrical installation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mary from Liberia. Presently, she lives in Airport in Margibi county which has the largest rubber plantation in Liberia. She is unmarried and lives with her four children at home. All of her children are between the ages of 2 and 16, and only three of them are attending school. Her fiancé is a security guard. 

For the past 3 years she has been doing business in the local market. Presently she is selling red oil [palm oil] and charcoal. She started this business with a little money from her fiancé and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes the flow of her customers and she enjoys the profit she makes sometimes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business. 

Her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in New Kru town. She is 30 years old and single with two children ages 6 and 8 that are in school and live at home. 

For the past 3 years she has been selling onion, pepper, Vita, and other items. She started this business by selling rice around the community with the few goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onion, pepper, Vita, and many items for her business. 

Her plan is to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onion, pepper, Vita, and many items for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single young man from Deir Elbalah city. He lives with his family in a very humble home. Mohammad's father is a worker and he gets a low income. He would like to buy a laptop for his son Mohammad but he could not save this amount. Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies business. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his study. By applying this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his study

loans.name: Vilma Evelin

texts.es:
Vilma de 27 años de edad, tiene 16 años de vivir con su pareja, con la que ha procreado 5 hijos, de 14, 10, 7, 6 y 2 años de edad debido a que su familia eran de escasos recursos, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado.
Actualmente su pareja se dedica a trabajar la tierra y  en la construcción.

Vilma se dedica a la venta de pan, diariamente camina alrededor de 7 km. En la comunidad para vender su producto, tiene 3 años de realizar dicha actividad que aprendió ella sola, con esto ella contribuye con los ingresos de la familia.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar más producto (pan) a su proveedor, debido a que la demanda es muy grande y muchas veces se queda sin producto antes de terminar el recorrido rutinario, con esto tendrá mayores ingresos y mejorara la calidad de vida de la familia.

Vilma tiene un propósito en su vida y espera lograrlo, ella quiere instalar su propia tienda en la casa, darle a sus hijos oportunidades que ella no tuvo y ayudar a su pareja con la compra de fertilizantes para trabajar la tierra.
texts.en:
Vilma, 27, has been with her partner for 16 years. They have 5 children ages 14, 10, 7, 6 and 2. Because her family was under privileged she was only able to study until second grade.

At the moment her partner works the land and in construction.

Vilma sells bread daily walking around 7 kms in the community to sell her product. She has been doing this work for 3 years which she learned on her own. With this she contributes to the household income.

The loan will be used to buy more product (bread) from her supplier as the demand is very high and she is often left without product before finishing her daily route. With this loan she will have a higher income and improve her family's quality of life.

Vilma has a purpose in her life and hopes to obtain it. She wants to open her own store in her house so that she can give her children opportunities that she didn’t have and to help her partner with the purchase of fertilizer to work the land.

loans.use: to purchase bread and resell the product.

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is a 54-year-old married woman with 4 children. 

She has a cattle farm where she has raised cows to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tasi has requested a loan to buy nails and barbed wire to build a wire fence for 10 acres of land. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. With her profits, Tasi hopes to buy more small calves.

loans.use: to buy nails and barbed wire

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Becoming a professional accountant has always been Judith's dream. Judith was accepted into the Universidad Saint Paul and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a loan, Judith plans on purchasing her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Judith feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Judith currently works 40 hours a week as a accounting assistant. With a degree in accounting she expects to earn $15 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Judith is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Uriel

texts.en: Uriel is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards his degree in accounting and auditing. He plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. Uriel plans on using the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. To help afford his school, Uriel works 30 hours a week but shares that making time to work and go to school has been one of his biggest challenges. With a career in accounting, he expects to earn $20 a day.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Blanca Soledad

texts.en:
Blanca has always dreamt of becoming a chef. Blanca was accepted into the Instituto Nueva Bolivia and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in culinary arts before graduating.  She plans on graduating in December, 2013 but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Blanca currently works 30 hours a week as a phone operator and earns $6 a day. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in culinary arts, she expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Blanca is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a multi-talented photographer who incorporates her work with memorable and creative concepts. Her skill and eye for design and art separate her work from others in the Houston area. Just take a look at her website, http://www.veronicastupublicidad.com/p/nuestros-servicios.html, you’ll notice the extent of Veronica’s work. 

Her five years of experience shows within her work. Playing with the balance of tones, colors and black and white elements within a photo helps her make the most of her shoot’s outcome as she directs her team, poses her subjects, edits and finalizes each shoot. However, Veronica doesn’t limit herself to simple photos.

As part of her business, Veronica can create logos, calendars, invitations and photo illustrations, and guarantees effort surpassing her competition. Veronica says about her photography, “For me, it’s an art, my passion and a blessing.” And her passion shows through her work as she views her job as a lifestyle--she works to perfect each project. Veronica states on her website that because of photography: “I have known the magic that holds a smile, a tear, a touch and a glance because I love what I do.” Veronica offers plenty more services.

She ventured to Accion Texas Inc. to obtain a loan to update her equipment and begin offering more services to a larger clientele. After a friend informed her about Accion, the owner of Veronica’s Arte Fotografico y Diseno decided to accept the loan saying her business wouldn’t grow without it.

Check out her most recent work on her Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Veronica-Fotografia/303801119630571/.

loans.use: to update equipment

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, four of whom are in school, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Ofelia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Rosario has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Rosario aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks of household items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Norcamar

texts.en:
Norcamar is 33 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Norcamar is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norcamar has been farming coconuts for nine years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn is 36 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Erlyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers.

Erlyn has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purches rice seeds and fertilizers
